text:
I've been there a few times to try their pho. First time it was ok. The pho tasted good. the waiter was nice as well. It's a bit pricey. 

Second and third time was disappointing. Waiters were still nice, but the broth of the pho had way too much salt and MSG, not to mention they put even more salt on top of the beef. 

Apparently the broth is pre-seasoned, and you can't order it with less salt. I'd suggest to go to Chinatown area to get some nicer and cheaper pho there. 

Food is 2 star, I added 1 more star for the friendly staff.

I'm from LA and was in Vegas for this past weekend. Had to come back twice. Had the ribeye pho the first time, so good. Next day I tried the oxtail pho, just as good. The broth was savory and delicious. A little fatty but not overwhelming. Staff was super friendly. Didn't expect it to be that great low key because I'm kind of spoiled with pho here, but definitely will try to stop by next time I'm in Vegas.
Great taste but DTLV prices. I prefer Pho Rancho as it is more budget friendly and closer to home but if you are down town definitely come here for the food and a cocktail.

My buddy and I were here today and we really liked the foods. We had the Le Pho Roll and House special pho. Every thing tastes great although the chef forgot to put the meet ball in our house special pho (?). A little bit slow service, but that's okay since it's new. Definitely come back next time.

Suggested by our server from Glutton.  Small place but  comfortable and cool music.  We had the vermicelli bowl and had great flavors and lots of fresh veggies.  Wish they had more menu options especially for vegetarians, but overall very good.

Unless you know it's here you could miss such an amazing little spot downtown. The place is clean and has the industrial décor- feel. Everyone was friendly and the food was delicious. I have never had pho before so I had egg rolls (which were so good I ordered some to go) and Vermicelli Noodle Bowl and it was very good AND filling! Our waitress Melissa was helpful in explaining the beer selection and all my questions I had about the menu, she recommended the friend rice and it was also a good choice. All in all I would definitely come again.

Found this hidden gem on instagram, didnt know what to expect when we walked in, gabe the bartender friendly and conversational recommended the ribeye and speing rolls my girl and i visit here every week at least twice now and bring our family and friends from california

One of my new favorite Vietnamese restaurants in Vegas! Great vibe and super friendly staff. The food was on point too! I highly recommend the Banh mi that comes with a small side of pho as a dipping sauce!! Best Banh Mi I've ever had by far! The Bio Bia spring rolls were also delicious with, simple yet very flavorful with amazing textures and fresh ingredients! Lotus root salad is also a must! So many pleasant surprises here. I can't wait until the whole menu is available and I definitely expect to be coming here often.
This is probably the best Pho we have had in town. Gotta try the Oxtail Pho, it was delish. Also great happy hour from 4-7pm with $1 oysters.

This place hits the spot on the right amount of coziness and convenience. There's low lighting and multi-level seating. It's not too loud and there is soft music playing overhead. The music is not intrusive (which means you can hold a conversation comfortably) so bring a date or enjoy your lunch break here in peace. 

We've been hit with this cold front that just won't quit and I can't think of a better way to warm up than with a big steaming bowl of pho. 

My coworker recommended this restaurant to me and it was a hit. We ordered the ribeye pho for $10.00 each. Once the broth hit the table, I added jalapeños, lime, sprigs of fresh basil,  and chili sauce to let them infuse flavors right away. 

The noodles are tender yet springy enough to grip with chopsticks. The flavor from the fresh meat and crisp veggies meld into the broth so much so that you can sip the remaining liquid and still taste the complex combination of savory, citrusy, goodness. 

I opted to drink their hot green tea, which is served in a petite, yet heavy, cast iron kettle. Careful, the whole pot is hot to the touch. The handle is narrow and it's a little awkward trying to pour the tea into little ceramic cups. 

The service was prompt. We were acknowledged right at the door, asked where we preferred to be seated, and taken care of quickly. The wait staff is friendly and helpful. In other words, if you are a novice to pho, these people won't make you feel inferior. Ask away and enjoy experience!

Delicious food! I know the art of chef Khai from his other District One restaurant. He is doing amazing stuff at his new venture Le Pho as well.  Since I decided to lose 30-40 pounds of my excessive  weight, I cut on carbs ... (wine is excluded from the banned food and drinks list) ... So, I ordered the Spcial Pho of the house with NO nudles and the Watercress Beef Salad. Both dishes were delicious. The ambience is very cozy and tredy. They also have a full bar and offer a variety of cocktails. I strongly recommend this restaurant if you are in the Downtown Las Vegas area.

While in Las Vegas attending CES 2017 we searched for Vietnamese food and found Le pho and happy we did. The signature appetizer ( called Le pho) was excellent and I could have easily made a couple of these my main course (5 to an order) but my oxtail fried rice was also very good. Everyone else either had oxtail or combination pho and everyone was also happy with their choice. You will need to plan for desert elsewhere as they only offer a coconut and you dig the meat out yourself after enjoying the coconut milk. We passed.

All and all, I give it 5 stars for great food and being an independent, small business putting out good food.

What a great compliment to downtown Las Vegas.  Everything is great!  My favorite is the Wok Tossed Filet Mignon!  They also have a pretty amazing happy hour with $1 oysters.. 
Our bartender Shauna was the best and made the suggestion on the filet..

In a city where there are plenty of late night Vietnamese restaurants to choose from, it might feel hard to stand out. But Le Pho is a truly a memorable place in my mind for a number of reasons. First of all, the decor is gorgeous! The deep green wallpaper and wooden tables are so romantic. Also, the big windows give guests a beautiful view of the City Hall's light show at night and plenty of people watching in the afternoon. 

Now when it comes to food, the flavors of Le Pho are unmatched. One of my favorite Vietnamese dishes is vermicelli with pork and egg rolls. This is by far one of the best egg rolls I have ever tasted. It doesn't taste homemade, but the flavors are so rich - there is no need to dunk it in sauce. 

My only gripe is that it's a little pricey for what I'd typically be willing to pay for Vietnamese food, but the portion sizes are generous so I'll let it slide. Overall, I am a fan!
Just great! I am such a fan. I love management and the owners. I eat here all the time!

I was incredibly excited hear Le Pho was opening in the food desert that is the legal district. I had many dreams of quick, delicious Vietnamese lunches in my future. 

The reality, however, resulted in much "meh."

I ordered the house Banh Mi that included taro chips. The portion was fine, not big. However, the big downer was the visibly burned baguette. Whatever great flavors lurking in the sandwich were destroyed by the overcooked bread. It could be flavor city in there but I'll never know. The taro chips also seemed overcooked -- but that could have been the residual burned bread taste overpowering everything.

Obviously, not every baguette is burned (I hope). But, quality control should be better for a $9.73 sandwich (includes tax).  I'll give it another shot.

So I just got my forsr Pho 2 weeks ago in Hanoi itself, one of the best dishes I ever had. So when I heard about this place in Vegas I was eager to try to replicate that flavor. Good place....nothing like the real thing but still worth it. Ordered the Pho with ribeye. I tought the pieces of ribeye were too long and big...kinda hard to work them with chopsticks. Still was good enough and prices were nice. I made a quick stop before heading to Downtown...its a 10min walk.

As a Vietnamese-American that has gone to 100+ Vietnamese restaurants around the US and Global, the food that I had tonight was okay. Environment is cool, overpriced, and food is okay, but if you are wanting authentic Vietnamese food with lots of flavor, not your place. 


Egg rolls: 3 pieces cut in 1/2 to equal 6. They were bit a greasy and soggy. 

Nem Nuong: 3 pieces on a bed of white vermicelli noodles and lettuce and they were pretty good. 

Duck Bowl: option dry or in broth and we got it in broth and it was extremely bland. They served the dish and forgot noodles! 

Pork vermicelli bowl: decent. Didn't like that they added fish sauce when served. 

Pho: overpriced and broth decent.

First off lets just say this....Food, great. Atmosphere, great. Service, great. So why the 3-stars? I'll just tell you a little story. I had a brand new debit card. NEVER used before or after eating lunch here, yesterday. However, I awoke this morning to find that $400 had been stolen from my account through a keyed-in card entry through a Square merchant account to a company named Fast Go, out of Brooklyn, NY. The first for $370, the second $30, and an additional failed attempt for $100. 

Now, to Le Pho's defense their card processing machine is out front where the customers can see it. However, the thick asian waitress (three waitresses walking around at the time, can't recall her name) that served us, swiped the card to process the payment, then looked up at me (as if to see if I was watching) and smiled, then disappeared around the corner for a couple minutes before coming back with my card to have me sign. Coincidence? Maybe. But I can guarantee if I ever go back, I'll pay with cash. Cancelled the card. Reversed the payments. Will get my money back in a few day.

All the servers here are very sweet and attentive! Le Pho is a modern Vietnamese restaurant, but the food was still just as authentic. Obviously, it doesn't compare to a home-cooked meal, but it came close. 

Love that Asian food is getting the exposure it deserves and Le Pho is doing a great job at making the menu friendly to those who are unfamiliar with Vietnamese food.

CHECK IN AND GET THE COFFEE, because their coffee was legit and absolutely delicious!

Two vermicelli noodle bowls (bun thit nuong) with egg rolls = $28, plus tip = $33. Kinda on the pricey side, but worth the experience.

Food here is awesome!! Me and misses walked from Fremont street to try it. We were greeted promptly and told we could sit anywhere we like. We ordered the egg rolls and spring rolls, and both were great. The egg rolls were light and flavorful. Definitely a treat, unlike most cookie cutter egg rolls. The star of the show was definitely the pho. I ordered the house special and added a poached egg, it was awesome. The misses order the ribeye pho which was also awesome, she also ordered the bone marrow oil which added a richness and dept of flavor to the pho. Thanks for the great service Jasmine, and thank you for answering all of our questions about the menu!! When in vegas, this will definitely be a must go to for lunch or dinner!
Just moved to DLV and this was the first spot I went. It was recommended to me by a friend. Visited during happy hour and throughly enjoyed the food/beverage as well as the ambiance.

Just not workin' for me. 

My wife and I have tried it multiple times, giving chances to have good experiences, and almost every time it ends in a disappointment. This time I had to add SALT to their classic beef broth it was so bland.

There are just SO many more places in Vegas that offer bigger portions, cheaper prices, and tastier broth. 

Sorry Le Pho, and hope your business the best.

AMAZING!!! My husband and I have been looking for a good Vietnamese place since we moved here and we finally found it. Everything taste like authentic Vietnamese flavors. My grandma would definitely approve...kudos to the chef!!!   The best Vietnamese food in Vegas is not on Spring Mountain.  It is downtown.  Food is priced very well.  Flavors are light and not heavy.  Who'd a thunk that?#buzzybytes

Giving 3 stars was kind've a generous gesture. Their menu is very simple only maybe 16 items on there at most. The place is more a modern american pho restaurant. The price is kind've steep. $12 for pho (yikes!). The food took quite awhile to come and they didn't give us utensils so we had to wait even longer. 

The food was okay, I've had way better. The pho broth is very sweet. The filet mignon was tender and cooked to perfection, but they skimped on the meat portion. The plate was more pine apple and bell-peppers than meat. And the bbq plate I ordered didn't even come with a side of fish sauce I had to request for it.

Once the food was finished the bill came out and our tab had an extra order of 3 bowls of pho which totaled out to $140? The waitress took her sweet time to come and correct our receipt. And then there is a service charge! Are you serious? Gratuity for 4 people?  Not authentic and pretty pricey.

I'm a low-carb eater, so you might think a Vietnamese noodle house would not be high on my lists of go-to restaurants. But Le Pho has some of the best salads I have ever eaten. So even if I don't partake of their tasty-looking noodle dishes, this is one restaurant that I hope to put into heavy rotation.

I have been to Le Pho twice now, and both times service was quick and friendly. On my last visit, I had the poached chicken salad ($9), which I probably would have considered the best on the menu if I hadn't had the watercress beef salad ($12) the previous week. Both salads were perfectly dressed (nothing ruins a good salad more than a heavy hand on the dressing), with a nice balance of meat and vegetables. The chicken salad was tossed with a light, sweet fish sauce; and the beef salad had a heartier ginger-soy blend. Beautiful presentations both times, and the portion sizes were just right.

Another great thing about Le Pho is that they offer iced green tea. None of that nasty passion-fruit concoction here! I usually order a glass of wine with a salad, but the tea here is so good that it literally made me into a teetotaler--at least at Le Pho! ($3, but well worth it.)

I may be the only person who orders salads here, but as long as these two winners are on the menu, I'll keep on ordering them. Delish!

My new favorite family bar restaurant downtown. Great service, happy hour menu & atmosphere. Wings are sooooo crispy . Tried raw oysters for the 1st time and i must admit i loved them!!!  Please try the fried egg rolls, oxtail fried rice & deep fried rice. See you guys next friday with friends!!!

I really love this place for Shrimp Pho. However, Jasmine the server should probably work elsewhere. She is not nice. She moves so quickly you feel like you can't sit and enjoy your food. 3 min after we receive our Pho she came and asked if we needed boxes. Slow down! Next the hot tea situation here is thumbs down. They brought it out with a sake cup. Can I get a tea cup ma'am? When I asked Jasmine about a regular sized tea cup she proceeds to tell me that's what Asian people use. BYE. Is this real life? She then tells me she will order some tea cups. Should have had those on opening day. Oh, I forgot to mention that my tea although in the fancy "Asian" tea pot was cold. We asked  Jasmine for napkins at the beginning of service, and I can go home shower make some hot tea, and still no napkins. Every other server here is amazing. They were very friendly and kind. If you come here make sure not to get Jasmine. Your dinner will be a 10 min. disaster.
Super delicious! Chicken banh mi dipped in pho was exactly what i needed to recover from a night out in Vegas.
I just had their happy hour Pho and Wings , and I think I just became a die hard regular.  Great quality And great price

Meat is actually cooked well here. Compared to other pho places. 

Two for one Thai tea is cool. It's green instead of the usual red and I like it. More mellow.

I can't wait to go back. 
But service was terrible. 
Party of 6 for a business lunch. 
Not enough chopsticks. And the two waitresses who said they would get more for us didn't. For ten minutes. With our food on the table. 
I had the pork vermicelli. 
The pork had five spices. And was awesome. Like gourmet bacon. But with less fat. So flavorful. 
I didn't even pay attention to the rest of the dish. 
The rest of the group expressed their happiness with the food and the consensus was to return. 
I guess I just need to relax my service expectations. 

Also, their beer list was inviting. Dinner next time for me.

Our favorite Pho place downtown and probably throughout the valley. We always go for the vegetarian pho and their garlic noodle dish is a taste orgasm. We just tried the vegan spring rolls and they are BOMB too.

LOVE LE PHO ROLLS!!! My favorite!

Definitely recommend Le Pho! The Le pho rolls are my favorite!! I crave them all the time! Not only is the food good the atmosphere and energy feels good! Out of all the times we've been there, this time around we got to meet a really cool guy Robert! He was an awesome server and bartender! Very attentive and personable! So fun to talk to! We always go back for the food and now will also be back for the awesome service!

The food wasn't bad but I've had better Pho and appetizers. I have never waited so long for Pho as it isn't a dish that has to cook. That being said the rare rib eye didn't cook in the broth as it had cooled down so much waiting to be served. Thankfully the waitress brought out some extra hot broth we were able to add. The ice coffee wasn't bad but the iced green tea was good.

Im teetering between 3 and 4 stars for this place, but I'll up because I think the potential is there.

Le Pho is a new Vietnamese restaurant in the heart of downtown Las Vegas, located inside the JUHL condominium complex. It was created by the same people that brought the popular Thai restaurant, Le Thai, the cool fusion like restaurant in Chinatown, District One, and his brother opened my favorite Vietnamese restaurant in town, Viet Noodle Bar. So far, by the looks of it, it should be a success.

After walking in, I noticed the interior has a really cool vibe, with a full bar, and lots of rustic wooden tables laden throughout the restaurant. There is pop music playing in the background, and it just encourages fun times.

I sat down and ordered some dishes. The server was really nice and I waited. What is cool is that there is a Spring Roll bar where all the spring rolls are made. I noticed the Banh Mi on the menu are in the $9 range. Not too sure how I feel about that, but, it could be some super special one that I've never had before. I might check it out.

Knowing that my food would take a while since this was opening day, I won't  comment on how long it took for my appetizer to come out, it was a bit... But there are hiccups to every opening.

Nem Nuong spring roll - they either offer this as an appetizer in a bowl form, or as a spring roll form. I ordered the spring roll version. When it came out, I thought it was OK. The flavors were all there and I really liked the peanut dipping sauce, I thought that the pork could have been better, and the rice paper wrapping was a little tough. But I thought it tasted 'just OK'.

House Special Pho - it came with ribeye, meatballs, tendons and tripe. First, I thought the broth, the most important part of the Pho, was good. A little bit more cloudy than I would have liked, but I could taste the beef and spices. I did have some wilted bunch of basil, but I just put that to the side. The meats were good though.

I was going to give it 3 stars, but it is opening day, and there is always stuff that needs to be refined, even after a business opens. I think when it's up and running at the max, it can just be as successful as their sister restaurants.

Le Pho is the sister of Le Thai.

Located on the corner of Bonneville at the Juhl, le Pho is an amazing little spot with fresh quality yummy Pho.

Close to our house we come here quite often. 

We always order either jasmine or pomegranate rooibos hot tea. 

Our app is always the vegan roll a soft hand roll filled with shiitake, radish, asparagus and other yummy veggies, including Thai basil. They come with a large dish of hoisin/peanut sauce. 

My better half always orders vegan Pho. Amazing broth full of flavor and A TON of noodles. Exactly how we love it. It has red onion, scallion, fresh zucchini, and sprouts on the side.
I always take all the Thai basil, lime slices and fresh jalapeño off the side topping plate. :D Hubs likes it without. 

Sometimes instead of Pho I order the vermicelli bowl and ask for it vegan. They pile it high with tons of fresh veggies and if I like they add crispy tofu or sautéed tofu. Its fine without it! 

Please check out the photos I have posted, their beautiful food will fill you up and keep you happy and healthy! 

They have tricking operating hours, check before you decide to come!
The broth for the Ox tail Pho is so flavorful. Picking the meat off the bone was a little messy but so worth it.

I just had the best ribeye PHO soup in Las Vegas!! The traditional spring rolls were out of this world as well! This soup is to die for. The Ribeye was thinly sliced and it just melts in your mouth. The spring rolls have a crunch to them and the ingredients are so fresh! We're from Tucson, Arizona and it beats any of the Vietnamese restaurants we have there. I may have to move to Las Vegas just to come here once a week.
back for more house pho, so good, hot, fresh and under $15, I'll be coming back for more and more

The table enjoyed many items: Nem Nuong, Da Nang fish cakes, watercress beef salad, the house Banh Mi, ribeye pho and Banh Beo. 
Positives:
-The food came out quickly which was great. 
-The ribeye meat in the pho was fantastic.
-Banh Beo was spot on!
-Watercress beef salad was delicious and a great portion.
Opportunities:
-The hvac system seemed to be down and thermostat read 88 degrees (yes, we were sitting next to hit). So it was a tad on the uncomfortable side.
-Our table also had to ask for the "veggies" for our pho, which we thought was standard (bean sprouts, basil, lime, jalapeños.

Me and my husband eat at many different Pho restaurants all over Las Vegas. This by far was the worst. The service was so slow. The atmosphere was so uninviting. The staff was completely clueless. The meat not sliced thinly. The broth was way too hot to even enjoy. And for a 4-star rating I expected much greater service than this.

Contemporary Vietnamese eatery near downtown. 

First of all, it is not where Yelp says it is on the map. It is actually on 3rd St. and Bonneville, right on the corner. It's one of the first floor businesses on the loft complex. Grab streetside parking for free on Saturdays and Sundays. Watch out for one way streets while navigating. It's best to approach away from Las Vegas Blvd. 

This feels like a chain as it is extremely polished from the styling of the decor and menu. The decor was more contemporary American than Vietnamese but the touch of a green color scheme and plants made it feel like Vietnam, otherwise it's a slightly industrial American look. 

The pho tasted exceptionally fresh and flavorful as it was served in a steel bowl. I had the special combination and all the proteins were delicious and satisfying. The meatballs were especially buttery. I felt as if the surroundings made the food taste better. The pho rolls with minced meat, grilled onions, and rice paper were unique and savory. Long story short - the food was phenomenal. 

The waitstaff were attentive and friendly. The view of downtown was nice too. We will definitely be coming back!

Amazing Pho! Great portion and exquisite broth. Though the person I was with got a light portion of meat in theirs compared to mine, wasn't sure why. 

We started with the Le Pho spring roll (Grilled five spice pork, basil, lettuce and scallion oil.)

It was good, different take on roll. Like a sushi Vietnamese spring roll. 

I also ordered The House Special Pho (A loaded pho with ribeye, flank, tendon, tripe, and meatball)

 Both were tasty and filling. The pho broth was great. Will try the Banh Mi sandwich.

This place was okay. I think they get so busy they aren't so tentative to the tables. We had to walk up to them and ask for silverware and refills. We all drank water so we just asked them for a pitcher since it seemed like forever just to get a refill.

As I paid for my parking and strolled up, my nose was greeted with fragrant herbs and Vietnamese food smells. This definitely increased my expectations. I like the open interior and feel of the place, clever to bring a cuisine that has virtually no comparable competition in the area. That said, it'll do in a pinch but you're better off making the trek to Spring Mountain for better flavors.

Ordered the Le Pho rolls to start, shared the House Special pho and Vietnamese Poached Chicken Salad. No effort was made to course dishes: my guy's soup came out before anything else, followed by our app, and my salad trailed along a little after. We were one of two tables. Our server overall was impersonal and disinterested. 

Pho was decent- broth was not quite as developed as I'd like, but portion was on par with average.  Namesake rolls were the favorite dish- popped with flavor, thanks to the garlic garnish, something I'd order again. Salad section seems to be on the menu to cater the healthy crowd but arrives looking like a plate of garnishes and no effort. Chicken was dry, portion was small, flavor lacking overall. 

TIP: Maybe also avoid the sandwich section of menu- a friend warned me the $10 bahn mi, even factoring the lack of competition, isn't worth even half the price.

Starting with a dining room that was way too hot - 86f, to the hostess / waitress that insisted on sitting every new party by the table next to one another when there was plenty of open tables as the place was nearly empty. Food was at best OK, and when looking for authentic Pho feel free to skip this place.

Cool and Hip Pho kitchen for the Downtown hipster crowd. Le Pho has that hip graphic look inside with murals and dark tones. It is located downtown a block form Las Vegas boulevard. There is street parking but you will need to pay for it. The food is good, and the service is pretty fast for that high activity lunch crowd. It has a full bar with happy hour so call for specials.

Favourite of strip Vietnamese restaurant!! My hubby and I always come here when we come into town from Canada 
Le Pho has become our go to when visiting Vegas! There green Thai ice tea is delicious and our favourite fun self wrap salad rolls are a must try!!
This place is awesome! A must go, and be sure to order le pho roll. I haven't seen this dish allot of other places and it's great. Also great Japanese whiskey selection. Good service and quick

Everyone has their favorite.  And this is our favorite Pho on the west coast.  

The chicken pho is very good, where it seems to fail other places.  

And of course, the egg rolls rock!

Our family loves pho and the broth is particularly fragrant and meaty.  My husband thinks the broth is a bit salty but the rest of us (5 of us) think that the broth works well with the rice noodles.  We order take out from this place pretty regularly as it is one of the few Downtown Las Vegas locations where you can actually park and pick up the food.  Their staff is friendly, although the service can be slow so call half hour ahead for take out orders.  Otherwise, if you are at the restaurant, plan for a longer lunch or dinner.

Le Pho deserves 5 stars for the smell it creates alone but when you get to the taste, hands down its game over. We ordered the Le Pho Roll, Bahn Mi Pho Dip, Garlic Shrimp Noodles and a Lychee Colin's.  With each bite, this little Kitchen continued to surprise our taste buds!  Needless to say, this place left us with such an amazing lasting impression from the restaurants environment, to the awesome staff and of course with every bite.  If your reading this, trust me when I say come here and eat, Le Pho is amazing! Enjoy!

If you're in the need for some comfort food, this place has good a great selection of flavorful dishes with a nice, enjoyable atmosphere. Come during happy hour and get food and drink at a great price! I had the chicken pho. It came out fast, delivered by a very friendly server. The pho was tasty and filling. I recommend this place as a great lunch or dinner option. There is a great looking bar with TV's overhead.
This was the best Vietnamese food I ever had so far. The food was great and I loved the ice cream ( taro)

Had lunch at this lil spot. It is a smaller place but nice. Diamond was our server she was very attentive and helpful with recommendations. The wait time from when we ordered to when we recieved our food was short. The place is very clean. The only negative things about the place is the music was a little loud. Other than that a great Lil place for some good food and cocktails. Definitely a place we will go back to.

Servers and atmosphere were nice. I would not recommend this restaurant if you are looking for fresh ingredients and an authentic taste. Spring rolls had ice berg lettuce that was frostbite and no basil or other fresh ingredients or taste. The chicken inside of it was leathery and stale. The vermicelli bowl didn't come with any egg rolls to be found :( . The only fresh veggie it had was a handful of bean sprouts. None of the  variety of fresh flavors you expect from Vietnamese food. It was accompanied by a sad little shallow dish of fish sauce. Come here if you don't know any better, but if you do.... steer clear! Disappointed waste of calories. I should have headed toward Spring Valley :/

In A Nutshell:

-Le Pho has a very warm & welcoming layout.
-I love the attention-to-detail from the classic Vietnamese locker-style cabinets, to the classy artwork artwork on the walls.  They really designed it well.
-The restaurant has an open layout minus a small wall near the bar w/ plenty of glass to let the sunshine in.
-The service was very good, stopped by here for a quick drink & spring roll appetizer.  Had to cancel one of the orders mid-way & the bartender hustled back to do it. 
-The spring rolls were good, but not the authentic Vietnamese variety you would expect, more show than taste.
-Also, glad they had Sculpin Grapefruit IPA on tap.

Overall, it's a very nice Vietnamese restaurant and I would come back again.
Fantastic as usual, thanks Jasmin! Highly recommend the Pho Dipped, I think I need one more to go....

We got two things.

1. The chicken bahn mi: awesome, flavorful, the right crunchiness on the bread

2. The duck noddle bowl: the duck and the sauce were a little too salty. Also, for $15 a bowl, they use dried shiitake mushroom. I mean, it's not like you can't use dried shiitake, but if you do it, do it right. They still got that funky dehydrated taste in them. 

Don't live in the area, but if I come to downtown, I'll definitely try the bahn mi again

The food here is so good.  We went here for brunch with my mommy group and it was amazing. They do a Sunday brunch theme there now which was awesome.  They also had bottomless mimosas which were a hit. I loved the Hangover Pho and the meatballs were so good.  Love it.  See photos of what our group ordered.  Wish this was in Summerlin. 

Will be back again!!

Simply the freshest, great tasting Vietnamese food in a hip downtown location!  Le Pho is one of my favorite places to eat.  Welcoming diners is a full bar with several interesting choices of cocktails.    On a cold day their Pho is just perfect!  Creative appetizers and traditional recipes make Le Pho a stand out among the other Vietnamese restaurants in Las Vegas!

Food is decent. Have been twice now. 1st time place was empty pretty much. Ordered a sandwich and a beer. Sandwich was tasty and on point cost of beer was pricey. 2nd time going took 2 other people and given it was packed but finally got a table after about 20 minutes. We all 3 ordered the Pho even more so because we were hungry and wanted to order the easiest thing on menu it took over 30 minutes before we got our 1st soup only 1 came out had to wait another 15 minutes before the other 2 soups came out, would have liked everyone to get their food at same time then when we did get it it was wrong. Could have been a simple fix because by the time our waitress finally came back we had picked out all the stuff that didn't belong in it and she could have just gotten us extra steak meat instead of just taking our soups away and it taking another 15 mins to yet receive a new one, which I suggested. We did get 2 fresh bowls and it was tasty decent broth still not as good as kim pho long my favorite place to get pho but it was good. Lack of service since, our waitress was so hard to flag down and not very good at her job and it taking a total of almost 3 hour just to eat so pho is way too long. I might give this place another try and see how it goes.

This is a regular spot for me, since it's in the same building that I live in. Nice relaxed atmosphere and vibe. The dishes are always consistent, so I know now what to expect whenever/ whatever I order. The LePho Rolls, a signature item, are addictive.

Gave this place a go for a family birthday dinner since we love Le Thai but wanted to avoid Fremont with my nieces. I'm disappointed to say that we waited sooo long to finally come here. The food is absolutely delicious, even according to my picky father-in-law who has spent years traveling in Asia. If they have the short rib appetizer available, grab it! Staff was friendly and accommodating of my shellfish allergy. It was casual and clean. We will most certainly come back and try some more tasty sounding menu items. Ps-the sign does not lie-one if the best Moscow Mules I've ever had!

A young and modern style Vietnamese restaurant. However I was looking for a bowl of authentic pho in a hurry. I am ok with the pho but not really impressed. However, it could be my fault as I could not find a old school papa mama shop but this one during the dark night. This could be an awesome bar if you want have some decent Asian food, beer and watching sports at the same time.

This place has a really cool vibe and the staff is really nice. I do think their menu is quite pricy for the pho it was 9$ for chicken pho. But it was totally worth it! It was really good, and our waitress Jasmine was super nice and provided outstanding service! I'll definitely come back again the next time I come to Vegas!

This was our first time and it lived up to the hype!!! We were really surprised how great it was. They have a full bar, so I started with the La Pho Julip. It was made with Japanese whiskey and was delicious. We had the Pork meatballs in lettuce cups and the Pork rolls for our appetizers. Our selection for entrees were Oxtail Pho, Ribeye Pho and the BBQ Plate. All were great. The service was perfect. Keep up the good work La Pho!!!! We will see you again real soon.
Oh em gee. My little family and I loved the chicken pho! Really good portion as well. Green Tea Thai Tea BOMB.COM I will always come back when I visit Vegas.

First off, I like the idea of having Vietnamese kitchen in a bar style restaurant. I love the ambience, food, and service. Just never seen any Vietnamese restaurants do this. Typical Vietnamese restaurants will be eat and go style....not much chill and socialize.

My most favorite food today was Nam Nuang roll. Love love the idea of having this dish in a roll. Usually it is a wrap style that sometimes it s a hassle to put everything together lol. Very smart idea.

Service was excellent. Our server was very friendly and very welcome to any questions. We ordered a chicken Pho to share, and she kindly split it for us too. 

If you are looking for a great place to hang out, this is a good option especially it is not located in a busy area.

Be aware!! When you check in through Yelp it says free green thai ice tea, but it's actually a buy 1 get 1 free so make sure you don't get fooled by this stupid promo. It's a small glass of iced sweeten green tea (nothing special) which they charge for $5 and I honestly think it's worth about $1. If you're looking for authentic Thai or Viet place, skip this one!! The food was either too sweet or bland. Plus the service was really slow.

I have never in my life finished an order of Pho. I can no longer say that now that I've had Pho from Le Pho! 

I discovered Pho about 10 years ago in Denver and regularly went all over the area looking for and enjoy great Pho. Since I moved here 4 years ago I have tried a few times but have been disappointed so often that I kinda gave up. Tonight though I was really craving Pho and decided to give this place a try. I had also read about their Phi Dipped, which is a Bahn Mi twist on a French Dip so it's made with Roast Beef but you dip it in Pho Broth. So I decided that I'd order both and just eat HALF the Pho. So much for that...

Pho Dipped - When I got the sandwich home I took a quick bite and was blown away instantly with how tasty it was. The bread was perfect and the flavors were great. I then dipped it into the Pho Broth. Words really don't give it justice! I have been also searching for a decent French Dip in this town and this may be my new go to sandwich. I can say that nothing I learned in etiquette classes was used eating that sandwich. I only regret not order two

I then finally got to my Pho. I got the special which has Ribeye, Tenderloin, Flank, Tripe, and Meatballs. Yum Yum Yum! The broth is so tasty that I barely added any spice or soy, which I almost always have to dump both into to add flavor. All the meat was super tasty and the noodles were perfect

I have to say I'm now a total fan. Next time I get a craving or Pho or Bahn Mi, I'm definitely coming back here

So i was pretty upset last time I reviewed Le Pho. But I decided to give it two more chances before i fully gave up. I have not ordered to go, and since then have not had any issues either time I went for lunch.
   The food is good andnthey are very good at helping me with my now one year old son. They made him scrambled eggs at my request. I feel bad because he made a bit if a mess, but (i believe her name is Jasmine) our server was super chill about it.
   Definitely plan on coming back in the future.

Everything we got was deliciois and we practically ordered half the menu. You really cant go wrong. The ginger checken was full of flavor, bahn mi was bangin. Spring rolls are better than most ive had. Bio Bia were the best spring rolls ever!!! Great overall experience for everyone in my party. New favorite pho spot!

This is my first time here. My son suggested it. He's been here before with a coworker. 
Talk about good pho. I had the chicken. It was so flavorful and delicious. Veggies were fresh, broth was so tasty. I would and will recommend this place. And hopefully come back soon.

We stopped by on a Sunday evening around 7pm for dinner. It was not busy and we were seated right away. The decor and ambiance is fun and comfortable. The servers are prompt and friendly.

We ordered some Egg Rolls, a Chicken Pho and a Vermicelli Bowl. The food was very very good. 

It's very likely we'll be back again some time. Good place!

This Place was actually Really good.  We were a little of Fremont and we just came across this restaurant. I have never had Pho Before but my friends said i would really like it.  When we first walked in we were greeted and seated.  Our waitress was very nice and prompt with our order.  I didn't know what to expect so i just ordered the Sirloin Pho.  I'm not that adventurous.  My friend ordered the same thing and his wife ordered the vegetable one.  It was acually really good!  there was a lot of flavors.  I was given jalapenos, basil, bean sprouts to add in and it was great.  The price too was awesome! The huge bowl was only 10$  I think that that is awesome! will definitily go back if i am able to locate the restaurant again.

Awesome place for lunch when you work downtown. It's a easy walk from my office. The waitresses are always on top of things and the food is delicious. I've tried the ox tail pho, pork chops with rice and their bbq plate. All are amazing! The have a full bar as well and they offer Moscow mules too! The wait is never long and your food comes quickly if your strapped for time.

Le Yummm! I ordered the chicken pho and traditional spring rolls and both were excellent. My kids ordered the chicken wings and a vermicelli pasta dish and liked them both. Le Pho has a great ambiance. Our server was attentive, friendly, and speedy. Prices were reasonable. Highly recommend.

i've tried several pho restaurants in Las Vegas and nothing compares to the broth of the pho here! It's so delicious and the customer service is great. I love the downtown area and this is one of my favorite go to spots!

I had such high hopes when reading the reviews on this place but was severely let down. We ordered the Le Pho Roll and the Duck Noodle Bowl. Everything was over salted and didn't have much flavor. We won't be back.
The atmosphere is very nice, pricing is okay but what I ordered didn't do it for me  ( Traditional spring rolls & Ox tail marrow fried rice) Service was nice as well!

Great! It's at the base of my apartment building, so it's quite easy to stop in for a quick-ish bite. They have a great assortment of food and a solid staff. There has been nothing here that I have not thoroughly enjoyed, so I will just say that you can't go wrong with ordering anything on the menu.

Why not five stars, you ask? To me, it deserves only a solid four stars because it is missing that "something special." The food is good, but not "wow" good. So, a solid four stars it is.

Big portion of pho, fusion type foods.
The portion is sufficient, flavor wise, it's definitely more in the bland side for me.
However, this restaurant most likely doesn't use MSG, so just add more soy sauce to your bowl :)
Excellent Service!
Service n food are good. But the hostess didn't  know what she was doing. We had to sit by ourselves. The bartender was awesome and he took care of us.

Call me picky. Phö broth is supposed to have undertones of nutmeg, but this place kills whatever flavor their soup base has with mass amounts black pepper. Great ambience, not so great soup. Been back once, probably won't again.

Great atmosphere, great service from Jasmine and great food. Drove by and thought I would check it out since I love Vietnamese food. It was just me, I really wanted the spring rolls, but being by myself the rolls and an entrée would be too much. I ordered the pho dip bahn mi. Tasty meat and vegetables in a crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside roll. The combination of flavors were great. It was served with a small bowl of pho to dunk in and some shrimp chips (imagine pork rinds with a shrimp flavor) They were good, but not something I would crave. I wish the sandwich was served with a small spring roll. Looking forward to going back and yes I will order spring rolls and take what is leftover home with me.

The vibe here is not like the traditional pho restaurant which is refreshing and different! The decor is modern with a mix of traditional. They have a bar and the lighting here is soft and not too harsh.  The noise level is average - background conversations seem like blurs but you can still talk to your party and hear them well. The menus are on a cork board, adding to the quirkiness and uniqueness of the atmosphere. The walls had art of Vietnam, which I enjoyed seeing, and everything was very well organized, even the bathroom was clean and nice. 

Before we walked in, you could already smell the pho broth outside the restaurant. 

This place has prices that's a little more expensive than other pho places that I've been to but you can definitely taste quality in their dishes. Their iced coffee drips so you can see the mixture of the condensed milk and coffee. It tastes so amazing - reminds me of the streets of Vietnam! It's not overwhelmingly strong but still has a rich taste to it.

I ordered the chicken pho and the broth was flavorful and the chicken not too tough. Our server, Jasmine, was polite and attentive, I love her nose ring. Jasmine explained the menu to us with confidence! She always checked up on us and talked to us in a friendly manner. Definitely recommend this place if you're in the area! It's closer to the Strip than Chinatown. 

The restaurant continued to be kind to us even after we paid for our meals. They were so sweet to us that they gave us two flan desserts, courtesy of the chefs. This is a spot that I indeed plan on making a return. Thank you, Jasmine, chefs, and staff, for making this a great first experience!

I love this place.

Everything from the Pe Pho roll to the Pho Dipped Bahn Mi. 

The two Chefs from District One and Le Thai partnered on this place and you can tell. Food's great, prices are amazing and finally a huge bar you can sit and drink at with friends in this part of town.
Vegan spring rolls awesome best peanut sauce.Visiting here from Fort Lauderdale would consider moving here just for the food

I've been here three times since this placed opened. And, the score is three stars because two of the times I've come, the service has been horrible. 

The first time I came was during the first week or so of opening. The place was swamped as to  be expected. My friend and I sat at the bar. Our orders were messed up, and I ended up taking most of my order to go due to using most of my lunch time waiting to get the food fixed.

The second time, I was blown away with the service. I was with about five other people, and the service was amazing. Everything was correct- food came promptly. 

And, then I went this past Friday, and the service failed, again. It took forever to get my friend's and my food ordered. I never really saw our waitress despite ordering and paying the bill.

However, despite the bad service, the food is great! My favorite is the Pho Dipped. I've ordered two of the three times. 

Perhaps, the alternative to the bad service would be asking for my food to go?

Finally came back to give this place another try I got the mule which is my favorite drink and they now have OYSTERS I love oysters they were fresh and yummy I'll definitely be coming back here more often now that I know 






Tried this place for the first time today since I live downtown and saw it was new decided why not let's give it a try??

I started with the egg rolls  super yummy probably some of the best I've ever had so delicious I honestly don't even know what I was dipping them in but whatever it was was AMAZING? 

I got there cocktail that contained Hennessy I wasn't very impressed so I'll try something different next time  

The decor was nice and the prices were fair 

I totally be coming back to explore the menu some more
Had the oysters a $1 during happy hour 4-7pm salt&pepper garlic wings and the oxtail pho with ribeye everything was fantastic service was great Salvador gave excellent service.

Stopped by this Vietnamese joint based on my lovely fellow yelpers reviews and I am so glad I did. I had the ox tail pho and oh my was it so great! Lucious creamy fat and meat coming off the ox tail blended so well with all the offer fresh veggies and yumminess in that bowl mixed for just a fantastic pho. I was wondering why other Vietnamese places didn't do this everywhere. I do not get out to Vegas often but I do know I will stopping by this joint to eat more of that wonderful ox tail pho.

I have eaten probably close to half of the items on the menu, and not a single one has let me down. If I had any complaints about this place, it would be that the smell of their food drifts over the pool at the Juhl, causing me to crave more of it. The Pho helpings are huge, so be hungry. Try the cocktails too, they won "Best Moscow Mule" in a Vegas bartender vote in 2016.

This place just opened around 2 months ago. 
It's owners of le Thai and district one. Two amazing restaurants. I had the vegetables pho.
I have tried most pho
Places in town and this might be the best so far. 
Fresh, clean delicious broth and fixings.
I will update next time I go.

One of the best meals I've had in a long time, I only wish they had this place where I live. It's casual, affordable, and the food is incredible! It's off the strip, you can get there for $9-12 Uber ride, it's pretty close to downtown Freemont Street.  Well worth the trip. Try the Pho Dipped is a banh mi which is made with brisket served with pho broth for dipping, it's a Vietnamese version of a French dip. So creative and so delicious! I'd also recommend the pho rolls as a starter, which comes with pork wrapped in flat rice noodles and is served with a fish sauce for dipping. Also really tasty!

Love the atmosphere of this place. The menus and small details add a nice touch to the vibe of the place . The Vietnamese drip iced coffee was delicious . The staff is amazing !! Our waitress Jasmin was so helpful and the chef went above and beyond . I  this place

Very good egg rolls ! The beef pho is the best.  I also enjoy the chicken pho option.  Stick with the soups and egg rolls you won't be disappointed. I always eat at the bar it's made out of some wicked wood. Still to try the sandwiches...

Take your favorite Pho restaurant and then amp everything up in regards to decor, ambiance and wait staff and that is Le Pho. The food is good, but rather pricey in regards to what you can get in your regular watering hole. A deluxe Pho bowl costs me $7.50 in my normal hangout. Here it is $12. Then again, you're in Vegas!

Came on a Thursday evening and it wasn't crowded. I ordered a Ribeye Pho for 10 bucks a pop! Really tasty soup but the meat was a little too chewy. Next time I might order the meat on the side. Thank you for the great service Jasmine!

My husband and I have eaten at many, many pho places and decided to stop here during our trip in Vegas bc of the 4 stars. Restaurant was clean, ambiance was inviting, hostess greeted and seated us right away. I ordered the house special pho for $12. It came with ribeye, flank, tripe, tendon and meatballs, so the works. Husband wanted the same thing, but without tripe and tendon. When our food came out, everything looked amazing. As we started eating, we kept finding HUGE pieces of ribeye slices in our bowls and if you've eaten at any pho restaurant before, you know that the meat slices are thin and able to be eaten without having to cut it apart first. Bc we had to cut it up first, we didn't really care to even eat the meat. I also found a few pieces of ribeye bone fragments in mine which def wasn't a good thing. Afterwards when our bill came out, I was charged $12 for mine, however hubs was charged $16 for his which didn't make sense bc his bowl of pho was exactly similar to mine but without tripe and tendon. What the waitress did was charge him for a ribeye pho ($10) and then did an add on of tendon (extra $3) and another add on on meatballs (another extra $3). Not sure how she thought that made sense, but overall, wouldn't return since the pho was not up to par.

Everyone always says they hate to leave a bad review but in this case I'm not even mad about it.

Where to start?  The busser who took a our drink order was very friendly, and that's where it stops. 

Our server was rude and short with us. 

We ordered two Bahn Mi and the Chow Fun with chicken. Then, once our food arrived (but before tasting it) we ordered a third Bahn Mi.  

As soon as we got it my friend bit into the Bahn Mi and was literally unable to bite through the meat.  I thought she was being a drama queen (she's weird about meat) but she wasn't.  I, also, couldn't bite through the meat.

At this point we tell the server that the meat is REALLY tough / pure grizzle and we can't bite through it.  Not only did she seem uninterested, she didn't offer any solution.

My coworker literally took all of the meat off the sandwich and ate it like that.  I got through less than half of my sandwich before giving up... and I can eat.  

We asked if it was too late to cancel the third Bahn Mi because we didn't want to torture our coworker, and again she was quite rude, she even said "probably" when we asked if it was too late to cancel as we didn't eat any of our own. 

We tried the Chow Fun.  My coworker spit hers into her napkin which wasn't a good sign. 

I tried a bite and it tasted like soy sauce and boiled chicken water.

Again we ask our server "is there perhaps a new cook or something because this doesn't taste right", but she just said "no, it should be correct".  


We've eaten here before and we've had BOTH of these dishes before and they were good in the past.  But this terrible service combined with terrible food and no offer of a solution has me questioning whether I will ever go back again.

Visited here for the second time. 

Arrived right before noon. 

Seated at the bar because I was visiting by myself.
Bartender attended me, got me a glass of water and gave me menu to look at. 
He came back in about 10 min, took my order.

 I asked him for wi-fi password. Because,,,lunch by myself? What else is there to do?
He told me it'll be on the bill and he'll bring it to me (didn't say when).

So I'm thinking to myself,,,I kind of want it now,,,when am I going to get it? how hard is it to verbally tell me the password? Or post it somewhere for everyone?

Sure enough, he forgot about my bill, and I didn't get it until I finish my food. He apologized, for your note.
I wouldn't say I'm mad, but it just doesn't make sense. If you are not about to let your guest enjoy free wi-fi, why would you even set up guest wifi???

Overall, first time and this time, their customer service just lacks. They are just "not rude", or "okay". Definitely could use more smile, and enthusiasm.

Their pho, is pretty solid. One of my favorite in Vegas.

Been going here for awhile now. Always a good meal. Never seen it busy. There were 4 customers + myself when I went there this evening. I placed my order to go over the phone. When I walked in, there were 2 employees behind the bar talking. I waited a few minutes before becoming inpatient. So, as my order was staring at me at the hostess stand, I removed the receipt from the take out bag & walked up to the bar with cash in hand asking if I could pay for my meal. A girl came from behind the bar & took the receipt. She then walked to the hostess stand, grabbed my order & said she would be back. She took my order to the kitchen. I work very hard for my $ so I walked out & went to another Thai restaurant that actually acted like they wanted my business. What a shame as it's so close to my house.
Standard pho done well. Service good food tasty. Had the pho and was very happy. Would go again in a minute. Highly recommended.
Yummy pho soup with ox tail sooo flavorful and tender.  My favorite place from now on!

I am very impressed with this pho restaurant. While the price is a tad higher than other pho restaurants, they put a lot more meat into the soup, which makes the price worthwhile. Both of my kids loved their soup. Their broth is very flavorful, but not over-spiced. The service was excellent. At the end of the meal they brought us complementary flan. We were very satisfied and plan to come back regularly

I've been wanting to try this spot since they opened. I'm a huge fan of their other spot, District One. I follow the Le Pho Instagram account and the food looks so appetizing. I'm also Vietnamese so I've been eating Vietnamese food all my life. It is my absolute favorite cuisine, for obvious reasons. With that said, I am always excited to try new Vietnamese spots.

I love the hip and urban feel of Le Pho. It's smaller than District One, but the decor is a similar feel. It's a cool space. The service was excellent. The food was good.

Place is bomb. 

Pho dip, grilled oysters, chicken wings, green tea Thai iced tea. All great. 

Great happy hour menu.

My favorite place for Pho! I have been really happy with all of the food I have had here. I have been here 3 or 4 times and each time I have wanted to come back for more. I really love their DIY fresh spring rolls.

We came on a Sunday evening. Parking seemed really simple and it was free. However, during the week it will cost money and be more difficult. The restaurant is located under the juhl. The block/neighborhood reminds me of New York City and I love it. 

It was happy hour (even on Sunday)! We sat at the bar and were greeted by a friendly bartender who got us waters upon seating (super attentive and we didn't have to ask). I ordered tequila shots and my friend ordered a cucumber mule... which was prepared so perfectly, it made my heart happy. 

We ordered the vegan spring rolls, vegan pho, and the BBQ plate (not vegan). The rolls were tasty! I am not a huge fan of tofu, so I might as for strictly veggies next time. The pho was something that made my heart happy. It was so flavorful, full of veggies... and portion was large enough for two. It's perfect for the upcoming winter and I recommend vegans and non vegans alike order it! My boyfriend had the BBQ plate and loved it. I can't really say much about it, other than he finished the whole
Thing with a big smile. 

I can't wait to go back to le pho. I may even have an afternoon there with my laptop and turn it into a working lunch!

I'm a Downtown Dweller and I'm very excited to have this restaurant in walking distance. It is even convenient when driving from work. 

They offer quick  & easy take out - with an option to sit in their serene bar area while you wait. Convenient street parking is available.
Pretty good.  Music a bit on the loud side. Don't have the usual pho I look for. Not so keen on oxtail soup. Nice environment and good service.
Great place! Love the atmosphere and the prices aren't bad either for a pho place. Server Suesun is pretty cool too. I'd recommend the eggrolls and oxtail pho.
Wow and yay! Can't believe it's finally here! A Vietnamese Resturant with a Bar that is awesome!

Excellent service, food, and atmosphere. The yelp check in for a buy one get one Green Thai Tea is awesome!! The lady complaining that it's a scam is obviously not reading the offer that's right in front of her face....clearly states BOGO offer!

Delicious food, great service and cozy atmosphere. The oxtail pho was incredible! As was the pork vermicelli bowl. We started the evening with the "Le Pho Roll". Delicious rice noodle wrap and delicious seasoned pork inside. 

The green Thai tea tastes fresh and delicious and is a must have. Shaundee our waitress was a rockstar.

I love this place and can't wait to come back.

Decor 10/10, happy hour 10/10, service 10/10 

This place rules. It's been difficult to find a solid Pho spot that doesn't have metallic-looking beef, yet here we are. Happy hour includes oysters, chicken or veggie/vegan pho, drink specials and more. Plus it's all absolutely delicious. LOVE IT!

Great ambiance. Had a date night here. Great food! Love the lemon tea mule and vermicelli bowl. Love love love the special salad. It wasn't on the menu and I don't remember what it was called. But it was awesome!!!
I'm from California out here for the weekend and decided to come to this pho and it is By far the best pho I've had and our waitress Diamond was so sweet great service!

Great service. Yummy, tasty fresh, well-made food. Had the house special sandwich and the sandwich with pho broth. Served with crispy chips. 

Nice craft beers on tap!

We definitely plan to return!!!
excellent...is all I can say, great pho,soup base excellent.  service fast and friendly...my to go place now

Very good food all around.  Very good service all around.  Friendly staff, priced just right, with a solid bar menu.  I came for HH (5-7pm, everyday) and tried some marinated pork and then chose the vegan spring rolls off the main menu.  Couple that with 2 for 1 wine and I was set.  Though portion sizes of the 2 things I ordered could have been bigger, I wasn't complaining because I was genuinely full and content with my choices.  The thick pork was marinated in a very thick sauce and with the addition of some sriracha, the appetizer was great. The veggie spring rolls were authentic and came with a delicious peanut dipping sauce that could be bottled it was so good.  Then the drinks during HH, 2 for 1 for a few beers and a house red and white, were good and well poured.  With many options on the menu to try, HH everyday (even weekends), and TVs and a good bar menu to choose from to watch a game after work, I will surely be back.  The only complaint would be the small HH food menu.  All they had was chicken wings, pork, and $1 oysters. All great options and rightly discounted, but hopefully more is added to the menu in the future.

I had the house special banh mi and it was amazing! Just the perfect amount of meat for the baguette. My gf loves this place because they had vegan options for her. Definitely will come back to check out the spring rolls and entree!
Pho is one of my favorite foods & I was so happy to find this place. They serve delicious pho & the interior was hip and inviting.

Decided to check this place out because it was within walking distance of our hotel. Nice restaurant with a nice bar, but the service was super slow and the pho was way too salty. Neither one of us could even finish our bowl of pho because of how salty it was.

I live at the Juhl building ( where this restaurant is located). called downstairs last night at 930, asked what time they close, they told me 11 pm. Perfect.. I changed, called from friends to meet downstairs for dinner at 10, walked in right behind a group of 3, that group was allowed to sit and order, I was told that that they were " no longer seating anyone". Um, and the three gentleman that you just sat that were being handed the menu? the restaurant had about 5 tables with people still waiting for food, I had called to confirm you close at 11 and it was still 10 pm, and you look right at my face and dont allow me to sit down for dinner. Ill be sure to spread the word at the Juhl and around downtown, stay away!

The ambience here is amazing, service is great, and the food is awesome. It's as authentic as you could get, and the fresh traditional spring roll comes with the right peanut sauce and is crunchy and fresh. The pho is legit as well. We walked over from the Fremont Experience and it was worth every step

I love that this place is literally a block and walking distance from my job.  It's definitely something different from the usual burgers, pizza and salad.  Finally, more diversity.  I read that this place is owned by some of the other Vietnamese Pho places like So Pho 1 that I usually go to.  

The inside of this place is very nice.  Looks very... classy and upscale, but it is a casual setting.  I like how there's a hostess that seats you like you see in a fancy restaurant.  

Food.  I ordered a Ribeye Pho and the Nem Nuong Roll, all to go.  The egg rolls at Vietnamese restaurants are one of my favorites.  Although the size of them where a tad bit on the smaller side from what I am use to at other Vietnamese restaurants.  These were way smaller.  I enjoyed the flavor, just not the size, especially for the price.  I guess that is what is expected coming from a downtown joint.  The Ribeye Pho was good too.  The flavor of the broth was good, but the ribeye itself, there was something off about it.  I don't know if it was just me, but the meat to me was chewy.  But it all tasted good.  

Will I come back, definitely.  So with that being said, happy eatings! @~~}~~~~
A gem in downtown LV. My fav was the pho roll, watercress beef salad, and the house special pho with the well seasoned broth. The pho dipped banh mi is a must try

Many times I've been to vegas and stuck with my usual favorites of places to eat but this time I took a chance and gave my palate a surprise & worked my way down the Menu lane ;) the simple flavors with a twist of Asian fusion has definitely reeled in my heart. Pow-Pow! Best ox tail pho in vegas! Flavorful broth but not over fully fatty, just perfect. The filet mignon aka bo luc lac was so tender & juicy just melts right at the tip of your tongue prepared on a bed of veggies with watercress! Don't worry , if you get thirsty , look all their big drink bar! Full of selections & those copper cups! Oh Do I smell MOSCOW MULE ?!?!? Great ambience & customer service just right in the heart of downtown, adjacent to city hall.

First of all, if you eat here you have to try the Green Thai iced tea. It's really good and also free at the moment when you check in on yelp.  The food was great and service was quick. Our server was suuper friendly. The atmosphere is cool and trendy. Will definitely be back again soon!

The design inside is great for date night or friends. I got the iced green Thai tea it was to die for its my absolute favorite! We got there during happy hour and got chicken wings which were crispy and had good flavoring. I was a bit disappointed with the pho because the chicken was too cooked and dry. Another con was that without siracha it had zero flavor or spice. Been to a lot of pho places and I was higher hopes for this one since pho is in the name of the restaurant. I will be coming back but I'll try something else. The server was kind and they had a friendly and fast staff.
The staff were great! AMAZING food! My favorite were le pho rollls and watercress beef salad. The coffee was good, just the right amount of bitterness and sweetness!

A downtown hit since the day they opened, I finally had the chance to visit a while back. Located on the ground floor of the Juhl condos the interior is dark and intimate, despite it's fairly large size.

This is more refined and upscale Vietnamese food than what you'll typically find on Spring Mountain Road. The oysters were one of the happy hour specials. A bit of a mess with bits of shell in them, it was a dish I should have passed on. The duck noodle bowl, however, was excellent with layer upon layer of bok choy, egg noodles, five spiced braised duck, mushrooms, green onions, and a poached egg.

Went in at 9pm on a Wednesday night.
Place was nearly empty; maybe just couple other customers besides us three.

Server was very nice and polite.
Food was however very disappointing...

Waited 20 minutes for two orders of pho and one vermicelli !!
Both pho had super salty broth; my supposedly raw beef slices were cooked to well done :( 
All the meats in the vermicelli were tasteless...
Tasteless!!

I didn't finish my pho; ordered duck noodle right away as I did not like my pho at all.... another 20 minutes later the duck noodle came out....

Again unbelievably salty lol no other flavors but saltiness was detected... we just laughed then paid our bill and left...

Disappointed. Was expecting the same level of service and quality of food as their sister restaurant le Thai but unfortunately they're completely off the mark.  Half full restaurant of guests and out of tea kettles, overly salted food, items on the menu aren't available because they're in the process of taking them off the menu.  Servers not attentive or friendly.  Had such high expectations but I'd say skip this and go to their sister restaurant around the corner.

Wow, what a great place. Atmosphere is very cozy and stylish, modern yet comfortable. The food was amazing, you have to try the house specials. Service was excellent and friendly. Definitely will be back!

First, it's nice having so many options available downtown now.  As a table we ordered the Ginger Chicken, Pork Vermicelli Bowl, egg rolls and BBQ Pork .  Some of the pork from the bowl was sent back to be cooked further.  Overall, all the dishes were good.  Personally, I prefer the value and atmosphere at their sister restaurant, District One.  Jasmine, our waitress, split our bill three ways without even asking, probably used to the work lunch crowd.  On a negative note two of us paid cash and she thought it was acceptable to keep the change and only return our bills.  I don't think this is okay and to me it's basically stealing so I'm not a fan of that.

I have been here a few time and ad several different dishes and it was long overdue to review Le Pho. Located downtown just north of the Arts District, Le Pho is a place I enjoy when in the area. I was a fan of his families restaurant in China Town so I knew I had to come here.
I could enjoy any one of their appetizers or just order several and call it a meal but I stick to one appetizer and either get the Pho or the vermicelli bowl.
-The oxtail Pho is my go to. Several chunks of oxtail still on the bone it melts in your mouth and is worth getting a little messy eating it right from the bone. Just enough of noodles and broth this is a perfect dish for me when I am sick or just need to warm up.
-Vermicelli bowl with grilled pork. Grilled pork, lettuce, bean sprouts and mint on a bed of vermicelli noodles, Topped with roasted peanuts, I like to order extra pork and add the egg rolls. This is a very fulfilling dish.
I like to find a reason to go downtown just so I can come here to eat. I will be back soon, very soon!!

Wish i could give 0 stars.. Walked in seat yourself had a party of 5 there was a reserved table big enough to accommodate and an open table for 4. The lady in charge told us to wait till an open table is available 20 min. I said ok we will wait. After waiting i walkedup to her and she said i actually have no servers and she's by herself but i saw 4 other waiters. I told her she should have told me that to begin with instead of telling me to wait 20 min. Durung that wait nobody ocuppied the reserved table. customer service sucks and i didnt see 1 asian person in there. Pho must not be that great. Small crammed restaurant.

The house special pho was very filling!! Tons of meat and broth. My sister ordered the shrimp chow fun and enjoyed it as well. Also don't pass on the green thai tea, it's really good if you have a sweet tooth ;)

If you find yourself in downtown Las Vegas and like Vietnamese food (or have never tried it), check out Le Pho. The restaurant is near the state courthouse and in walking distance of the Fremont Street Experience (if you don't mind walking). It's on the corner of Bonneville, in a decent area of downtown. The food is decent. It is not "blow you away" good. But it is decent, filling, and fairly-priced, for downtown. Is this going to be the best pho you ever had in your life, if you are a fan? NO. But it won't be your worst, either. The service is knowledgeable and mostly pleasant. A good lunch.

Great food, great atmosphere, and great staff! The food is delicious, fresh, and tasty! The staff is very welcoming and the atmosphere is relaxing. I will definitely be making several more visits to Le Pho because it makes my belly very, very happy!!

I guess I care about flavor too much? If you've been to any other Pho spots here in Vegas you'll know the minute you sip Le Phos broth that it's mediocre at best. Will not be going back unless it's completely free. I love pho, but this place had some pretty bad tasting pho, had to throw it away. And I rarely throw food away.  I was disappointed because the location is great, but not worth wasting money on this place.
Le Pho is Le Bomb!!! Bomb food, bomb customer service, and the bartender....bomb.com!! He has the sexiest voice  I will always be coming back!

I have to give my experience here a 3. My mother and I are Celiac and had been assured by our friends at Le Thai and Bocho that Le Ph? would have something for us. They were not wrong, although the staff had next to no clue what we were talking about when we said gluten free (we were offered vegan and peanut free things, neither of which were gf). 

The decor is beautiful and the restaurant was clean and open. Not too busy. 

We ordered the beef ph? which we split. It was quite delicious. The broth was nicely seasoned, and the noodles and meat were very well cooked. Nice ceramic bowl, and stayed warm throughout the meal. 

We also ordered the traditional Spring Roll after being assured it was normally gluten free (it is not). We were served the roll and my mom took a bit of a huge piece of wonton in the middle. Wonton is usually made from wheat flour, but after we asked the waiter (who was friendly and patient) she told us the chef said it was rice flour.
Ok fine. 
Except literally 30 seconds later another waiter came running out to tell us it was not gluten free, and my mom already ate some. So she is going to be sick later. The chef remade them without the wonton, and they tasted quite good (although personally I am not fond of raw mint). The peanut sauce was great. 

Also had the Hennessy cocktail on their menu (the name escapes me). For the amount of drink vs ice (it's mostly ice) I would say it's a bit overpriced, but quite delicious, and beautifully presented. Beware of the stir stick with the cherry. I got a splinter in my lip trying to get it off of there (I blame my dumb luck). 

So essentially I wouldn't go back unless the staff gets some allergy training. Gluten intolerance/allergies are fairly common knowledge now, and I think they should know what gluten free means. 

It's too bad because the pho was really, really good...

Update: both Mom and I got quite ill after eating here. Celiacs I do not suggest this place.

I heard about Le Pho from a coworker and didn't realize there was a pho restaurant downtown. Well I'm happy to say there is and it's really good! The service was awesome and the waitress was super kind and helpful. We were seated right when we walked in and right away I checked in on Yelp.

I got the house pho and Vietnamese coffee which was delicious. If you are around this area and want your fix of good pho with yummy broth I'd highly suggest stopping by and eating!

I was craving a pho and searched for a Vietnamese restaurant and found this very modern and chic place. I was a little bit skeptical at the beginning that it might not be authentic, but the food was very very good. They had a happy hour menu until 7pm on weekdays and so we ordered the Le Pho rolls as an appetizer and I had the oxtail pho as a main. The pork in the rolls was perfectly spiced and the oxtail in the soup was tender and delicious. The food really surprised me in how flavorful and authentic it tasted.

Best vegan pho I've ever had. 
Not being greeted for 10 mins in an empty restaurant and having to walk to the back to ask for a table kinda sucked though. Our server seemed very annoyed with us for being there. Went there on Monday night an hour and a half before they closed. As a previous server I know that's kind of annoying but we just really wanted pho and heard great things about this place. Overall, really great food!

Nom nom nom, I love Le Pho! This place is easily one of my favorite downtown spots, seeing as I crave it at random. They have an awesome menu filled with affordable dishes for just about everyone, including vegan and gluten-free options. My personal fave is the ribeye pho - however, I'd always suggest getting a bahn mi sandwich just to dip into the broth if you can - they even have a sandwich + broth combo already on the menu if that'd be something you're interested in. So yummy!
This is a great and very quick place to get a delicious bowel of Pho! The vibe is upbeat with their modern wood and metal decor, it's totally welcoming! You'll love this place... And the food!

My first experience trying Vietnamese food and I loved it!  The food was delicious with great flavor and the staff was friendly and very attentive to our table.  Our water glasses were never empty and the food didn't take long to come out.  I have told many people about my experience and can't wait to go back!

First off, google maps takes you to the vicinity of the restaurant but luckily I was able to find it with another quick right turn. Street parking only and free after 6pm. 

Our server was nice but forgot to mention 3 items that they were out of. So basically all the items I wanted - they didn't have - the Nem Nuong, Nem Roll, Lotus Salad . I ordered the Le Pho roll which was delicious. Probably one of my favorite dish. And the duck noodle - also very tasty. The Chowfun with shrimp- the shrimp was so salty. And also the $17 vermicelli with egg roll and shrimp - shrimp also very salty and definitely not worth the $17. 

I would come back hear just to eat the Le Pho Roll again. I guess come during lunch time when they have all the items available.
Oxtail pho and house pho were good.

Guys, I have been excited about this place for awhile now. Pho is my favorite food, and having great pho near where I work was only a dream...until now.

I ordered Traditional Spring Rolls and a Pho-dipped Banh Mi, and was not disappointed by anything. The spring rolls were fresh and delicious, and the braised pork in the banh mi was insanely good, perfect crunch on the bread, as well as some spectacular fillings and a beautiful savory broth.

Is the menu overflowing like some of the Spring Mountain joints? Of course not. This is a restaurant that you can tell wants to focus on perfecting the things it does, not trying to do all the things half assed.

One more note: The absolute best service. In the world. That is not hyperbole.

Enjoy, DTLV.

Best Pho place I've had since moving to Las Vegas! I had a favorite place back in Washington State and I couldn't find any just as good until Le Pho. Not only is the food really good, but the amount; that was the first time I couldn't finish a bowl of Pho. My family and I came here for my birthday and the employees were so accommodating and nice. It probably helped because they were local (from Hawaii). They also brought out a HUGE piece of cake and Ube ice cream for me. Seriously, this place is awesome and definitely recommend it to Pho lovers and anyone just looking to relax and dine.

Food: 6/10
Service:4/10
Price:5/10

I had really wanted to like Le Pho more, having been to both Le Thai and District One, but left severely wanting. My friend and I showed up on Wednesday night at 8pm, was greeted and sat very quickly. Our server comes by and takes our drink order, returns with drinksand takes our good order as well. We both order the house special Pho (he got the bone marrow scallion oil on the side) and I ordered the house special Bahn Mi as well.

After not too long of a wait our Pho comes out. The meat that is on top is close to the rare/raw side which I'd not s problem as it should cook in the broth, however the broth was more on the high warm side than steaming hot. The broth was okay to good, but nothing to write home about.

The bowl was nicely filled out with noodles and meats, but we both thought the ribeye cuts of meat was a little too chewy, but otherwise nice. After discussing or thoughts on the Pho (about quarter of the way in) the Bahn Mi I had ordered had not come out, nor had our server come to check on us.
