After asking to see our server and inquiring about the Bahn Mi, I was told that the kitchen forgot to fire it and they would be working on it. By the time my friend and I had finished our Pho the sandwich still hadn't come out. Was told that they were working on it, and because it was taking so long they would comp the sandwich. 

It finally comes out, and we try it and I like it a lot. I assume most of the ingredients (bread, pickled veg, pate, maybe the cold cuts) used in it were made in house. I think the Bahn Mi tasted better than the Pho, my friend thinks the Pho is a better value than t
he Bahn Mi. Bahn Mi is $9 and the Pho is $12. The Bahn Mi is severed with a side of taro chips, which I am usually a huge fan of, however the order of chips I received was a dark brown mess. It tasted burnt and of oil, and there was no crisp. That covers most of the food side of things. My friend really liked the bone marrow scallion oil, but he did note that it make the Pho very heavy (I had warned him too).

On the service side, I think I saw food runners and bussers more than our server. The guy was nice, maybe he was in the weeds, although it didn't seem that busy. Overall, I think Le Pho is okay, the food is solid, the service could be tightened up (or maybe it was a bad day). The price though I've had similar quality of pho and Bahn Mi in Chinatown for less, but as it is downtown, I understand that the price will be inflated to adjust.

What the Pho??!!

On a nondescript corner somewhere between the strip and downtown, in a place without the casino foot-traffic of flip-floppy marble-walkers or downtown project coolsters, and in the midst of Bail Bonders, court-goers and Juhlers, you'll find this very rough diamond of a restaurant.

With its pedigree and good chef, one would expect it to be more memorable than it is. 
After all, following the Subway-ization strategy that has infected pizza places and burrito joints of late, it has a spring roll bar (sounds like something you'd put on race car in April, doesn't it?). 
I mean come on; a bar where they make spring rolls is cool, right? 
But even that doesn't quite work because it's in the back, out of sight, not in the front, so you lose the pleasure of marveling over the careful construction of the food you're about to consume. 

And the treble-in-paradise acoustics of the room can only be described as Keith Moon doing an extended solo on your eardrums! 
(For anyone under the age of 50, google "Keith Moon", dammit!)

The core problem is that the menu is as slim as a runway model and almost as simple-minded. I can barely remember what I ate! I think there was soup involved.

In a world where only special sells, and only spectacular lasts, none of that bodes well.
food serve bit slow.. said no onion but the food came out with onion on the top of the food
This place has great food and everyone working is always really sweet! jk not really

I've never had Vietnamese before, let me tell you, it's full of flavor. And Le Pho delivers! With a great location and atmosphere, perfect for lunch or dinner. nothing has disappointed me on the menu!

This place is PHOnomenal! Le Pho is my favorite place to eat in DTLV; I'd even venture to say it's one of my favorite places to eat in the whole city. In fact, when it came to soup, I was an I-prefer-ramen-over-pho type of person until visiting Le Pho. Now I'm obsessed with pho, though I'm finding other establishments don't really compare to Le Pho. Of course, with any restaurant, much of this can be attributed to personal preference but let me break it down for you:

Ribeye Pho ($10): The broth is perfect- it's so flavorful. This is a favorite of mine and I've had it many times. There's plenty of nice pieces of meat- meaning, you don't get just the fatty pieces. Personally, I enjoy clean pieces of meat so this is a winner for me. You can split this dish, and all pho dishes, into two bowls for an additional $3. They charge you extra because you get a little more pho than when it's just in one big bowl.

Chicken Pho ($9): Before trying the Chicken Pho, the Ribeye Pho was the apple, er.. pho, of my eye. Now, I constantly crave the Chicken Pho. The broth is also incredibly flavorful and delicious. Plenty of meat-- a lot of white meat, which I enjoy. The noodles are perfect as well.

Oxtail Fried Rice ($14): Amazing flavor. This has become a regular order for me and my boyfriend. Pro tip: get it with a fried egg on top for $1.50 more.

Traditional Spring Rolls ($7): Had these once with the gluten free option. The wontons were removed and I was offered fish sauce on the side instead of peanut sauce. Nice, fresh flavor. Great beginning to your meal.

Chicken Wings ($8): The tamarind sauce is very tasty. I love the flavor combo going on here. You get six wings per order and my only complaint is that they are on the small side.

Taro Ice Cream ($5): This was a dessert option the last time we dined. We thoroughly enjoyed the combination of taro, shredded coconut, and crushed peanuts. It's perfect for when your belly is full of pho but you still want something sweet to top off your meal.

I've enjoyed everything I've tried with the exception of the Bone Marrow Fried Rice. To me, it tasted heavily of fish sauce, but I don't even know if that is a key ingredient. I'm not a big fan of bone marrow in the first place so don't let my opinion on this dish sway you away from trying it. I'd like to sample more of the menu but I come here for the pho!

My only gripe is they can be inconsistent. One time I ordered Chicken Pho and it tasted like a different broth than usual. We also brought some friends here and the Ribeye Pho was so incredibly salty. We were slightly embarrassed after raving on and on about the broth; we insisted to our friends that it's not usually that salty. One thing that is consistent though is the service. The waitstaff and bartender are always fast and friendly. Veronica is our favorite!

Oh, and if you have allergies then you'll be in heaven here. They are allergy friendly and many things on the menu are gluten free or optional, including all the pho. Just talk to your waiter about your restriction(s) and he or she will check with the kitchen for you.

Give this place a try! I'm so addicted that I make the drive from Summerlin to DTLV once a week just to eat here. I recommend Le Pho to all my friends and family!

TL;DR 
Get the pho.
This places not authentic and the pho is not that good. Very small uncomfortable dining area and the service was horrible.

Place was amazing!!!!  My hubby had the pho and I had the garlic noodles!!!  Definitely coming back everytime we visit Vegas!!!  Our waitress was amazing and very sweet. Close enough for us to walk to from our hotel!

BEST Pho ever!! Get the Ribeye Pho. So. Good. 
They have the industry brunch on Sundays with great music. I usually go there before pool parties. You will not regret it.

Well. Mixed review here.

The food tastes good, and it's a cute little spot.

But the service was horrible. I had to ask for my server after waiting 10 minutes to be greeted. Food took awhile to be served; and when it was, I wasn't asked if I wanted anything else. I had to call another server over for bean sprouts and jalapeños...and had to ask 3 times for siracha sauce. I've never been served pho without basic bean sprouts and jalapeños. 

Has great potential. But they really REALLY have to step their service game up. One last note, they were skimpy on the noodles. I'm used to tons and tons of noodles in my pho. I ran out of noodles before I finished the meat.

I literally uttered awww!!! I was sooo sad that I had just taken my last bite of their juicy banh mi.  Definitely could have this everyday.  This place would be better if the servers have a better vibe.  Is hospitality dead in Las Vegas?

Love to eat here. But today they arent taking pick up orders due to an event? 
Is this a restaurant or what?

They have rebuilt my trust!! Nikki the manager was pretty amazing and she earned A+ for professionalism!!! I literally hate bad customer service and she's provided me w the best service and rebuild my trust in this restaurant!! Definitely will keep coming back because of her!! Thank you

So I went here because of recommendation from friends and I have to say I am truly impressed!. The atmosphere was great and the staff were awesome. I love this place had a fully stock bar, so if you wanted to come here to catch some sports games you could or go on a date. I would highly recommend getting the le pho roll. Also if you like love Bahn Mi sandwiches get the pho dipped. Definitely will be coming here again.

It was okay. I had the beef salad, and it was a tad bit too salty for me. I would most have definitely gotten the pho but to be honest it was so hot in the restaurant it felt like the AC was not working so Pho on a hot Las Vegas day would be a major "no." Definitely need to try to come back when it's colder and try the Pho.

This place looks beautiful on the inside. Very modern and clean. The people are friendly and attentive. There's a full bar available and a few draft beers. There is a vegan Bahn mi and a vegetarian pho option. I ordered the vegan bahn mi it was super good but after awhile the amount of ginger and garlic was overwhelming. I tasted it for the rest of the day. The bf got the pho dip, very flavorful but the meat was tough and very chewy. They didn't use the thin sliced meat that comes in the pho. The reason he enjoyed it so much is because the flavor was there.

Probably the best place downtown to eat at.  I come here at least once a week and usually ends up to be to 2 times a week.  I always get the Chicken or Ribeye Pho.  The chicken Pho is really good and worth every penny spent.  Now the Ribeye is even better than that.  I could litterly eat the ribeye every day.  I ordered the egg roll and spicy chicken wings as an appetizer and those were just as good.  I have never had bad meal here.

I highly recommend this place to every person I know.
Not really a fan of pho with beef broth and shrimp but the soup was tasty, just a little salty. We didn't want to pay $2 extra to get vegan broth. Service is great! Recommend this place
Food on point and consistent. Service real good!  Chicken pho, wings, and their rolls were great!

This is the first pho place I've ever been to that looks modern! The ambience was great. The restaurant was pretty big, and even had a sleek bar area with new tv's playing some sport game. The waitress' were super friendly and stopped my every once in awhile to check on us. Though the restaurant was modernized, the menu was authentic Vietnamese food. I ordered a pho with beef balls, and my boyfriend got a pho with all the different meats. This is the first and only place I've been to that had green thai tea on the menu. As an avid thai tea lover, I had to try it. It tasted almost the same as regular orange thai tea, but with a bit of a matcha taste to it instead. It was delicious. Our food arrived quickly. The broth was really hot, but didn't burn our tongues! The meat was great, and the broth was delicious. Not bland or overly salty. I was content. I was only able to finish half of my pho, but my boyfriend finished his and the rest of mine.

I got the chicken pho and it was delicious. The broth had wonderful flavor and there was a good ratio of meat to noodle. I was surprised that there were no fixings offered- I had to ask for Sriracha and hoisin. But I'd still go back on another lunch break!

Unfortunately I recommended this place to a coworker and she found a large meaty bug in her meal. The waitress came over with a napkin and swiped it up after my coworker flicked it out and dug out the legs of the bug from the meal. Of course the meal was comped but that may do it for me with all places that don't make good in front of me. The front desk lady was also rude when I went. I got lucky with just the rudeness.

Tasty, a bit of Asian fusion cuisine, the right portion. The server was  pleasant and yet sort of distant. We were 5 people in our party.
We ordered 2 vermicelli bowls, one for me, they were better of what we expected. My other friends ordered pho soup, 2 chicken (Not the traditional style which my friends mentioned that "it's like a cup of noodles...", generic and somehow "flavorless". Another plate of rib eye pho, according to my friend "it was delicious and filling".
Some dishes are over priced such as the Spring and Egg Rolls and the Oxtail fried rice that it was requested for take out.
I'll go back again and order the Vermicelli bowl again.

Parking is free at night when I got here. Restaurant interior is cozy and clean. I liked how they have pictures with the menu. Checked in here to redeem the bogo green Thai ice tea.  the price for one is pretty expensive. It's $5. My friend and I ordered the diy platter spring roll and the house special pho and we shared everything. It was delicious. The pho bowls are pretty big and they give you plenty of meat. I like how they give you more meat than noodles for the pho. Other places usually go cheap on the meat and give you more noodles. The broth for the pho was good as well. I liked the protein given in the diy platter. Shrimp was good as well. Definitely will come back for happy hour and to try their other dishes.

My partner used to work next door so I  would stop by and grab lunch with him on occasion.

Le Pho is a cute spot in the Juhl with interesting decor. If you look closely though, certain individual elements clash with each other but as a whole it seems to work.

The menu seems pretty standard for a modern Vietnamese place. We usually just get the special pho. I like that you can have additional toppings like herby oils and whatnot.

My indicator of good pho is this: after the meal, do you and your clothes smell like pho? In this case no. There pho here is a little more nuanced, a little more refined. Not saying it's good, not saying it's bad. Just ok.

Service is good during lunchtime. We usually get this one kid who always checks with the kitchen if this or that contains wheat flour, soy sauce or hoisin (gluten allergy).
Great place! Food was delicious. Visiting from L.A. and  was hungry for some good Vietnamese food. I was not disappointed. I will be visiting everytime im in Vegas.

The le pho rolls are great! That alone is the reason for my 4 stars. The pho itself is ok more in the 3 star range.  The broth doesn't have the depth of flavor a traditional pho place gets and the ribeye appears to be cooked before it is put into the soup and it all in one clump. Lastly they need more onion in the pho.  The add on items are nice but not needed if the meat if these items were just corrected.

Awesome food!! Everything is so flavorful and nothing tastes the same as another item. The drinks (especially the Moscow Mules) are BOMB! The green iced tea is tasty too. The staff is wonderful - so kind and attentive to our needs. I'll be back again and again!

I wanted to love this place, but there was a lot left to be desired. 

I was shopping around the North Premium Outlets and had an intense craving for pho. Instead of traveling to Chinatown, my handy dandy yelp app lead me here  (and less than 10 minutes away from the outlets - wooo!)

I ordered their house special pho, nem nuong, egg rolls, grandma's grilled pork, and the bbq plate. 

Combination pho definitely satisfied my craving!  A little on the expensive side when you're paying $12 for pho though. 

Nem nuong was not worth it, at all. I guess I was expecting something along the lines of Brodards style and I did not get anything like it. I felt like I was eating a spring roll full of lettuce and mint. The pork patty was non-existent and there was no crunchy wonton inside! I was so disappointed. 

Egg roll was decent. A little on the small side and I feel the fish sauce was much needed to pump up the flavor. 

Grandma grilled pork was recommended by the hostess and she said it was different than the pork found in their BBQ plate. Though their flavors are different, I enjoyed the BBQ plate pork more. Grandma's grilled pork was too salty for my family. And even though I know it's an appetizer, it was tiny. I think there was about 6 pieces of pork in the appetizer. 

The BBQ plate was delicious and filling. Comes with pork and short ribs, rice, and topped with an egg. I think this meal has the most bang for your buck. The only thing that was missing was the fish sauce you pour all over the meal. I'm used to doing that at other Vietnamese restaurants, but maybe they don't do it here. 

I also think it's crazy that they make you pay extra for the scallion oil and other add ons that are included for free at other establishments. 

I really wanted to love this place since I love Viet Noodle Bar and District One, but Le Pho sadly falls short of the other two.

My wife and I were staying nearby on Freemont Street, and we were looking for a good Pho restaurant in the area. We found this restaurant through Yelp and I must say our experience was amazing! The restaurant has a hip vibe with a nice bar, craft beer and cocktails, as well as a full Vietnamese menu. We were promptly greeted as we sat ourselves by the bartender, she was very friendly and took/brought our drink orders quickly. We both ordered the beef pho and shrimp spring rolls..they were both delicious. The meat was definitely some of the best I've ever had in a Pho soup, and the flavor of the broth was outstanding! I want to try the sandwiches next time we're in Vegas, because they have excellent reviews as well. I highly recommend this to locals and visitors to the city.

Love this spot! Great pho and great spring rolls. (Try the Le Pho Roll!). They also just started a new happy hour from 4-7pm, which includes $1 oysters. Definitely worth checking out when you're in the downtown area!
Love the broths and fresh ingredients, consistency is there. I prefer the veggie pho, but love the brisket once in a while. Also the rolls are amazing and the watercress beef salad is to die!!!

This is a very good downtown option to get your pho on.  The buffalo wings that I had as an appetizer had a nice Asian twist to the flavor.  Nicely spicy and cooked to a perfect crunch while remaining moist.  The pho was also tasty.  The broth was nicely seasoned and there was a good balance of noodles/meat.  I'll be back when in the downtown area and don't want to trek over to Chinatown for pho.

So, I am picky when it comes to pho, esp. considering I'm from MN, we have affordable and great pho restaurants! This place is not bad, but I don't think I would consider it authentic Vietnamese pho. I've been there twice and to me, it's a hit or miss. This time around, the pho was pretty salty, and the pho roll was practically falling apart. Not sure if that's how it's supposed to be wrapped?

Downtown is booming and thanks to the new addition of Le Pho, it just got even better! If you're looking for some traditional Vietnamese dishes that we haven't seen yet in Vegas then this is your chance. Everything we tried was excellent! From the spring rolls to the Banh mi pho dip! I guarantee you will be blown away! Cheers!

This place looks cool and it's conveniently located downtown. Unfortunately the vegan broth is literally water. No flavor at all. It makes it so you cannot have the vegan pho because the noodles are totally bland as well. This place would do well to improve the flavor of their food. Especially considering the prices are quite high.

Very modern atmosphere, and really unique flavors. The portion was huge, much more than I would've expected. Attentive service (but not intrusive). I had a wonderful experience, and would definitely recommend it for locals and tourists alike!
I came for a late lunch and ate at the bar. Quick service and the bartender was friendly. I will be back again.

Tried this place today for lunch...ordered takeout. 

To start they were out of chicken at 11:30am which is weird. I tried to sub beef on the salad and they said no so I had to get pork instead. The salad was for my assistant who is newly diagnosed as having celiacs. I told the girl on the phone...not sure she believed me. Sorry...not just the gf trend here. Some ppl actually can't eat wheat. Anyways, the salad made her sick. Obviously not gf.

I ordered the vegan pho & spring rolls. She asked how many spring rolls so I thought they were a la carte. They're not. I ended up with 6 orders of spring rolls (was ordering for the office.) WTF. At least they'll keep in the fridge....I guess. For future reference, they're 2 per order.

The vegan pho was underwhelming to say the least. The veggies were over cooked & mushy & flavorless. The broth was ok, but mostly just salty. The noodles were weird...not normal pho noodles. They almost looked like ramen. It gave me a tummy ache.

Overall I can't recommend the food. Also the pho in Chinatown is 100x better.

Came to visit a friend who lives at the Juhl and he recommended Le Pho due to convenience and he likes the food.  I rarely have Vietnamese Food and didn't know what to expect (thought it would be too spicy.)  I was delicious!  I had the WOK TOSSED FILET MIGNON and my friend had the Vermicelli Bowl with Pork.  They kindly omitted the bell peppers from my dish.  The service was great - we ended up sitting at the bar and while the bartender had to check on the menu options, he was very friendly and didn't seem to mind my questions.  This is a great location if you're downtown and especially if you live at the Juhl!  Good prices and a nice mellow EDM soundtrack.  I was on my own on Saturday and after a busy day, I ended up back here for takeout.  

I'm not giving this five stars only because I don't have any experience with Vietnamese food and don't know if it's THE BEST...but it could be.....

FYI, the service both times was great.

Again, I live a few feet upstairs from this joint and really want to go and eat because it's so convenient. The food is solid, but the service is literally THE WORST! We went downstairs to grab a drink and have some food and thought maybe, just maybe! Sitting at the bar would get us better service. Completed opposite, sat there for 10 min. And was never even asked if we wanted a drink :/ we left. I won't be returning until this place get their act together..... I hate leave bad reviews but this frustrates me so much :/

I just rolled into Vegas from a circuitous trip from Atlanta to Denver to SLC to a couple hot springs and campgrounds, all by car, got a few days in Vegas before my languid trip back up to Portland. (I'm spoiling myself. You should too.)
As I tend to do, the first thing I do when I get back to civilization is get some pho. Being that Portland considers itself the pho capitol of everything, I was a little cautious at best, bring my first time in Vegas. I was pleasantly proven wrong!
The drinks are top notch and the pho is fresh, delicious, and very quick. I am impressed. Will, my bartender/server guy, was friendly fast and efficient. And it was only after I ate that I found out tonight was their soft opening. I'm doubly impressed. You'd have thought they'd have had years of practice.
So if you like pho and stiff drinks to go with it, this is your jam.
I'm not telling any off my Portland friends, but this beats most their favorite places.
The chicken pho here is very good. The best was very juicy and tender and the broth ass tasty as well. It took about 25 minutes to get our food after ordering... A little too long especially for pho.

Wanted to try something new (to me) downtown, and was feeling in a sandwich mood, so we popped in here. Not too busy on a Friday, but the only seating was at the bar. C'est la vie, on with the food!

Had the House Banh Mi, which was very delicious. A splash of Sriracha brought out some more flavor, on top of an already very well put together sandwich. Also had the green tea Thai tea, which was a little sweet, but not overly so. Liked it all.

Cool location, interesting industrial interior. I would be curious to come back for dinner, or happy hour when they have what look to be some great deals happening.
Nice renovation, modern and fusion. I love pho! Soup was salty :( both chricken and beef taste almost the same. service was good!
My boyfriend and I went here last night for dinner. And the food was really good. Oxtail pho was really good and the service was great! We'll definitely will go back to this place.

Everything was amazing! We ordered the pho house special, my hubby ordered the oxtail pho, and we all split a chicken banh mi. Our waitress Michelle was so attentive and helpful during our whole meal- we def enjoyed her and the restaurant. 

We normally do the routine- Pho Kim Long and all the other restaurants on Spring Mtn, but I'm gonna say it. Broth is everything to me, and Le Pho surpassed Pho Kim Long! 

We will definitely be back!

Worst experience ever was told my order would be ready within 20 minutes 40 minutes later she came back and said 5 more minutes then she said they're really busy it's going to be another 20 minutes
Not to mention the C rating on the wall by the Clark County Health District
In Vegas for work and had had to grab quick bite. Vegan gluten free Pho was pretty dang tasty. Will definitely stop in again the next time I'm in town.
Very delicious oxtail pho. Staff is very friendly and attentive!  I love the ambiance of this quite modern look Vietnamese restaurant.

This recently opened restaurant has good genes with Dan Couglin of Le Thai and Khai Vu of District One being the principal owners.  You can find many restaurants serving pho in Las Vegas, but Le Pho has raised the bar based on our experience, though visitors without vehicles may find its downtown location a bit of a deterrent.     

We started off with egg rolls (northern style with pork, crab meat, wood ear mushroom, carrot & cellophane noodles) that were accompanied by a small bowl of dipping sauce, lettuce, carrots and basil.  The rolls were oil free and the best we have ever eaten.  My wife ordered pho gia (chicken soup) while I settled on the pho ribeye.  These were accompanied by fresh basil, lime, slices of jalapeno and bean sprouts.  The base of each soup was delicious, both proteins were succulent tender, and the noodles bountiful.  The sourcing for all ingredients was clearly a cut above as was the décor and service

Located on the ground floor of The Juhl directly on the corner of Bonneville Avenue and 3rd Street. Ample street parking surrounding the building and beyond. Very easy to access and away from the the usual tourist traffic of DTLV.

After three visits, I've had a really good sampling of the menu. There are still a couple dishes I want to try, so I would definitely try those on my next visit. Bottom line: great food and great service. Although the location is very far from me, I'm happy to make the drive!

Chicken Wings ($7): Crispy Wings quick-tossed with housemade tamarind sauce; topped with garlic chips. The chicken is cooked well and the sauce is delicious. There is a Five-Spice Salt and Pepper version ($5) offered during Social Hour (4-7PM daily) that is also really good.

Egg Rolls ($8): Fried Northern-style with pork, crab meat, Wood Ear mushrooms, carrot, and cellophane noodles. Crunchy and tasty; a solid egg roll.

Traditional Spring Roll ($7): Shrimp, pork, vermicelli noodles, fried wonton, bean sprouts, mint, and lettuce. Decent, but nothing exciting.

Vegan Spring Roll ($7): Fried tofu, shiitake mushroom, bell pepper, grilled onion, lettuce, mint, and bean sprouts. I love this option for my non-meat eating friends, but there wasn't a lot of flavor going on.

Le Pho Roll ($7): Grilled five spice pork, basil, lettuce, and scallion oil. So, so much flavor in the pork and accompanying ingredients. The rice noodle is perfect, too. This is my favorite roll!

Nem Nuong Roll ($7): Vietnamese pork roll, fried wonton, lettuce, bean sprout, and mint. Just like the Traditional Spring Roll, this is just okay and not very exciting.

Bo Bia Roll ($8): Lap Cheong, dried shrimp, shredded omelet, and jicama. This is a fun "breakfast" roll that is also very tasty.

Lotus Root Salad ($10): Lotus root, pork, shrimp, roasted peanuts, cilantro, and fish sauce vinaigrette. Served with sesame rice crackers. I love the crunch from the lotus root and everything tastes so great together. Great low-carb option without sacrificing taste.

Vietnamese Poached Chicken Salad ($9): Poached chicken, cabbage, red onion, rau ram (Vietnamese coriander), crushed roasted peanuts, fried shallots, crushed shrimp rice crackers, and fish sauce vinaigrette. This was good, but no exciting flavors either.

House Special Banh Mi ($9): Toasted French baguette with pork cold cuts, pork pâté, mayonnaise, pickled daikon and carrots, jalapeño, scallion, and cilantro. The bread was crusty, but soft, so it was the perfect vehicle for this popular sandwich. Tasty, though it could use more meat!

Pho Dipped Banh Mi ($11): Toasted French baguette with slow-cooked beef brisket, bean sprout, basil, pickled daikon and carrots, jalapeño, hoisin, and sriracha sauce. Served with a bowl of pho broth. Even though I'm usually drawn to a traditional Ban Mi (I loove the meats), this is a really great sandwich and their pho broth is seriously amazing.

Ribeye Pho ($10): I had this on my first visit and it revived my faith in Pho. Again, the broth is phenomenal and the vermicelli noodles are just amazing. I've had the House Special Pho ($12) as well with Ribeye, flank, tendon, tripe and meatball. Also wonderful.

Vermicelli Bowl ($17): Grilled pork, lettuce, bean sprouts, mint, crushed roasted peanuts, scallion oil, fish sauce, and vermicelli noodles. *Add Shrimp and Egg Rolls. They have the best vermicelli noodles in town; it's slightly thicker and have a great texture. The dish itself is fantastic. The charbroiled pork and shrimp are really delicious.

Ben Thanh Market Fried Rice ($12): Dried shrimp, Lap Cheong, eggs, and diced asparagus. Topped with salted egg yolk. Everything about this dish would make me think I'd like it, but it was rather bland compared to a lot of the other flavors going on in this place.

Hoi An Chicken Rice ($10): Poached chicken, pickled daikon and carrot, and turmeric rice. This is very similar to Hainan poached chicken. The chicken is flavorful and prepared nicely. The rice is also tasty and everything is great together. Add Nuoc Cham for added deliciousness.

Duck Noodle Bowl ($15): Five-spiced braised duck, thin egg noodles, bok choy, shiitake mushroom, organic Onsen egg, scallion, and garlic chips. The dish was a little salty, so that made it hard to fully enjoy, but the noodles and ingredients were great.

Wok-Tossed Filet Mignon ($18): Wok-tossed filet mignon and seasonal vegetables with black pepper sauce, watercress, red torpedo, and spring onion mix. Served with white rice. A good version of "Shaking Beef;" flavorful and tender steak.

Banh Beo ($9): Steamed rice cakes with ground mung bean, dried shrimp, scallion, and crispy pork rinds. Not bad, but it was missing crispy shallot and lacking slightly in flavor.

Favorites: Le Pho Roll, Bo Bia Roll, Pho Dipped Banh Mi, Ribeye Pho, House Special Pho, Vermicelli Bowl, and Hoi An Chicken Rice.
Very tasty and nice atmosphere. Service was great. My first time having Pho, so can't compare to anything, but I liked it and thought it was very good.

I'm not a vegan, but I like to eat that way from time to time and I like it when restaurants can make it great. Honestly, most vegan pho I've had has been very bland until now. Usually tastes like boring vegetable soup. The vegan pho here is right on track, tastes very Vietnamese. Best vegan pho I've had now. The vegan spring rolls were excellent, too. They have fried tofu, shiitake mushrooms, and mint in it. I also had the oysters (excellent) and the poached chicken salad has a light fish sauce vinaigrette which was delicious. I would order everything I tried again. *contented tummy pats*

This was in my top 3 Pho I've ever had. It was fresh and savory at the same time. I savored every noodle and sip of it. Service was great and I enjoyed the cleanliness of the restaurant. I definitely recommend coming here to be transported to heaven.
Very disappointed I got the veggie pho & it had no taste. I had to add salt! Not worth $9, looked pretty tho.

When I'm ever in a town not LA I try one Vietnamese pho house. There are others in LV and I've tried a couple of others, but the food here is tops. It's not your typical Vietnamese pho house because it's really a sports bar. And maybe that's why the food is so good. Drinking food. For sure. The menu is small and that's a good thing. Many pho houses have menus that are pages long and have more than one hundred items. What you order here is what you'd order at any other pho house. The restaurateur has just simplified it for you. Others have pointed out their favorite dishes so I won't do that. You can order anything knowing it will be good.
Exceptional.   I expected to not be oppressed because it's a "hip" place. I just wanted a good bowl of pho. Wow, did they ever deliver. Sooooo good

This place was sooooo fire!! The beef watercress was my favorite, and it is a dish I would come back for. We also ordered the DIY spring rolls, the shrimp in those were perfectly seasoned. The green Thai iced tea tasted like a root beer float. The service was top notch. Michelle was super helpful with giving recommendations, and she was very attentive to all of our requests. Next time we're out in Vegas, we'll be stopping in here. Thanks Le Pho!

Place is pretty good..average price like $11-$14..big serving for sure. They gave us military discount so that was nice the only complain I have is that they charge $3 for extra broth. Waitress was kinda annoyed when we asked to separate our broth from our noodles. Umm not our first time taking pho home duh!  Overall will come back and maybe try the other fusion items they have on the menu.

I came to this place as I was perusing downtown LV. It was a bit chilly outside so I knew some pho would be good. I was immediately greeted and told to take a sit wherever I wanted. I sat next to the bar and was given the menu quickly. I was so impressed with their happy hour menu! They had so many options, including chicken and vegetable pho for less than $4.50. WHAT! I ordered the chicken pho and hoped for the best. They also had 12oz beers (Miller, coors) for $2. 

To my surprise the pho was very tasty! It had a lot of chicken and noodles. The broth was flavorful too. For the price paid during happy hour there is no way I can complain. I highly recommend visiting then (I believe it is from 4-7pm). 

THIS restaurant is only for people 21 and over!!! No minors allowed! Just thought I would point it out since they have a sign inside that says this.

Cute n chic Viet fusion joint at the Juhl. Came in on a coincidence as the wife and I were looking for a quick lunch before our movie started... came in during happy hour (not sure when they start and end, but we came in at 3PM) they had 5$apps n half priced selected pho (chicken or vegies) I had the chicken pho which came out to be $4.50... we started with a signature appetizer called the le pho roll which is a stir fried pork wrapped in a rice noodle, then we had the salt and pepper wings (6 pieces). For our lunch I had the chicken pho and my wife had a roast beef Banh mi dip (just like a french dip but with pho broth) my bowl was pretty big and filled with lots of shredded chicken and fresh herbs. 

tldr; food was good, service was good, and you can get one free refill on the awesome macha thai tea when you check in for the 1st time
Mmmmm mmmmm good! Had ordered everything on specials list. Fried rice/ the Vietnamese-phill cheese steak/ garlic noodles and short ribs on point! Thanks for the great food

For the most part, I basically only write 1 and 5 star reviews on Yelp.  Le Pho was definitely worthy of a write up from me in the good way.

My wife and I stopped in las night and were completely happy with the food and service.  We were immediately pleasantly greeted and seated by the host who upon hearing it was our first time, gave us her suggestions of what to look for on their menu.

We took her advice on the appetizer and ordered what are eyes landed on for pho, the ox tail and ribeye.  Starting with the Le Roll, it was a great take on the traditional Vietnamese spring roll.  We loved the new approach and of great flavors and presentation while still keeping the essence of the dish.  As we were very hungry walking in, and because it was so good, the appetizer did more than its job by raising our anticipation for our main course.

I had ox tail and my wife the ribeye pho.  Admittedly having a little less finesse with chop sticks as I would like, my clumsy self was able to separate the succulent meat from the submersed bone with ease.  The small effort was completely worth the energy spent the instant I had that first taste of ox tail, pho noodle and broth.  I devoured my entire bowl with each mouthful producing my audible satisfaction.

My wife's response was equally as satiating.  With each initial morsel enjoyed, we'd have those exchange of glances as to wordlessly express "I know right?!?".  Being that she has a smaller stomach than me, she was not able to finish her portion, which I had no problem with... More food for me!!!  Having quickly finished my bowl, I was only happy to make sure we got our money's worth and made her dinner disappear.  Though more traditional of a pho than the ox tail, it was still a super tasty execution that shouldn't disappoint any pho enthusiast.

Ultimately we ordered a flan for dessert to end everything on a sweet note.  Which ended up being the perfect end to the meal.  The flan was light and custardy as opposed to dense or over drenched in syrup.  It was bouncy on our spoons and everything a flan should be.  And ultimately, it just the right sweetness to be the last flavors we took away from our visit.

We were very happy with our visit to Le Pho and will absolutely be back again! The food and service was awesome and when downtown craving a newer expressive take on Vietnamese food, we know where we will be going!

Amazing place ! The food is incredible and the atmosphere of the place is very mellow.  Service was very good and the staff was very polite.

Definitely coming back whenever I get the chance

I'm conflicted- whereas the food is usually great here, take out is not the best. Pho has been cold, they don't cut the spring rolls in half, or cheesesteak, the cheesesteak had low quality meat last time- it was tough and there wasn't much of it. I come here at least once a week and was just here Tuesday night. The food and service were great, as it is most of the time. When it's busier than usual or they're understaffed, it does take a while for food to come but otherwise, the response rate is pretty great, particularly when you sit at the bar. I love the atmosphere and convenience to where I live. Happy hour is pretty bomb- oysters are great. I would definitely recommend this place to friends and family, esp as a dine-in experience.

Vietnamese cuisine at its best. Spent a low key saturday night here a few blocks away from the crazies on Fremont street to take in some garlic chicken noodle. Damn tasty if you ask me. The food was quick to the table and the server was friendly and professional and helpful. There is a nice size full service bar in case anybody is parched. Hey! that reminds me of a joke i heard in Ireland  ( 2 Irishmen walk out of a bar ........................ It COULD happen !!!! )

Enjoyed it immensely.   My mom's side of the family is from South Vietnam and their pho is the real deal because everyone knows the magic is in the soup.  Very rich and flavorful broth and will go back soon!

This Vietnamese food was fresh-tasting, well prepared, and served in a trendy eastern inspired environment. If you're willing to spend an extra few dollars per item, this will be worth it. I had the vegetable Phó with tendon, nice variety. But the French dip bahn mi sounds pretty amazing...

"Even in Town they make food for your people?" begins Midwest poker bud as we look over the menu.

"That's it, guys, it's time to play Fear Factor, Asian style with the gentleman of fairest complexion" I announce to snickers, then...

"Haha, no weird Asian stuff!" joyfully proclaims farm boy America.

The brainchild of  Chef Khai Vu of District One, Le Pho serves Americanized Vietnamese that happen to work well while grabbing a drink on a DTLV pub crawl.  

Americanized equals familiar flavors and ingredients.  No culantro, lighter extraction in the pho broth, unusually light hand in use of fermented fish sauces, sour flavors missing.  Bottom line, traditionalist, don't ditch your favorite Chinatown Vietnamese eatery just yet.

First and foremost, this is a bar that serves Vietnamese food not the other way around.  Food pairs with drinks.

For shareable dishes, "Grandma's Grilled Pork", soy marinated pork cheeks; juicy,  somewhat chewy.  A tasty bar bite.  Good assortment of rolls, the egg roll, crispy and stuffed full with pork, crab, shrimp, rice noodles, and toothsome wood ear mushrooms.  Rolled in lettuce, dip in the sauce.  Good as any.  Interesting "Le Pho Roll, unmistakable flavor of five spice pork and lettuce rolled in a wide sheet of uncut pho noodle and dressed with a scallion oil.  Interesting but one dimensional.   A lotus root salad with pork, shrimp, cilantro, peanuts dressed in a fish sauce vinaigrette and served in crispy, airy rice cracker has an unexpectedly mild flavor.  Eat it fast or the cracker gets soggy and sticks to your teeth.

The pho doesn't measure up to that of its sister restaurant.  Perhaps an off day.  Light and almost watery.  The house special contains a good portion of raw ribeye, flank, clean and tender tendon, soft tripe and meatballs.  Opt to add some bone marrow for added richness for $1 more.  Begs for hoisin and chili oil to be dumped directly in the bowl but satisfying none the less.

Note:  Typical Southeast Asian service.  Dishes are brought out whenever they are ready.  This is customary.  If you don't like it, order in waves but be prepared for some annoyance on the part of the servers.

Decent selection of beer.  Reasonably priced.  

Pub crawl worthy, yes. Meal worthy?  That depends on you.

This place is more than just good food and great service, it's an experience. I have been here multiple times and every time I try something new I am not disappointed. The pho is amazing, the coffee is amazing, the tai tea is also incredible. 
The lovely bartender Melissa, and the server Jasmine and Mercy were extremely helpful with explaining the menu both times I have come here. Great place, amazing food, and even better service.

2016 Yelp 100 Review Challenge 56/100

After dropping off donations at Las Vegas Rescue Mission we were hungry so we decided to check this place out. It's located at the bottom floor of The Juhl condominiums. If you don't know the area you'll probably miss it and have to circle back around, like we did. 

Compared to other Vietnamese restaurants in the valley, this one is modern and pricier. The only one in downtown, the vibe and pricing caters to the downtown area. 

I loved the interior design and spacious feel. There's a full bar and happy hour options as well, which other Viet spots don't have. I looked them up on instagram and they host private events and events for local charities which is awesome. 

Looking at the menu, I had no idea what to order. I didn't want Pho, and I wanted to try something new, I asked the waitress and one of her suggestions was the Pho Dipped. I decided to try that. My friend got that as well. 

Pho Dipped $12 - Bahn Mi with a side of pho broth. 

For the taste, size and price it was just OK. It wasn't salty, which I liked.The flavors were mediocre, nothing bad, but nothing great to make up for pricing. This was not worth the price.

I had never seen a Green Thai Tea before, so I really wanted to try it. It was buy one get one free with yelp check in offer. Offer shows "1 Free Green Thai Iced Tea", we didn't see the fine print. Price is $5 each. Small size. Thought that was pricey as well. 

I guess you pay for the ambiance here. 

Our first waitress was okay, felt a little rushed. While we were eating, her shift was ending so another waitress took over. The second waitress was friendlier, more helpful and knew what she was doing, like she's been doing this for years or owned the place. I only ate a half of the bahn mi. She offered durable takeout containers. Didn't expect a container for the broth, which was nice. She also offered to split the bill for us without us asking. With tax and tip we each paid about $17. That is pricey for what we got. 

I would come here again to try the happy hour and if I'm in the area, but won't order the Pho Dipped. Other than that I'd rather go some where else.

Another amazing place to eat. Huge portions so make sure your hungry. I tried the ribeye soup, was excellent!!! The beef broth is so good I had to tip my bowl to mouth and drink it. I recomend Le Pho highly.

I love to come here and I do almost once a week if not every 2 weeks. I recommend their pho and their vermicelli bowl. Although it's not really authentic Vietnamese food, they put in a modern twist to it 

If you call in for pick up, make sure to check your food and make sure everything is in there because almost every time something is missing or is not the right order. 

I wanted to try something different so I tried the WATERCRESS BEEF SALAD which comes with beef, watercress, radishes on a bed of cilantro. I pick up, come back to find no watercress or even the radishes. So it was beef and cilantro. Very disappointing for whoever prepared this meal. It's also a very small salad for $12.

I may or may not live in the vicinity,
But I'll tell you that this place is awesome!

I'm a fan of le Thai and district one 
So of course I had to check it out.

I've come many times already in different days and different times of the day. For the most part I have come when it's pretty quiet. Which I prefer. The staff are always friendly and attentive.

I have even ordered take out and it was promptly made as communicated. 

My favorite is their French dip banh mi sandwiches. It's the best of both worlds when I can never decide what I want. I'm still not sure how I feel about their taro chips that come with it as I have never tried them other than here. 

Are they suppose to Taste burnt ? Not sure. Either way it's great to have something different in downtown. Recommend this place highly wish they had those yummy buns from district one.

The waitress was nice. Enough with the good, let's get to the pho. It wasn't good at all, if it wasn't for the Sriracha and hoisin sauce I just don't if I could have taken the few bites I did. I am almost certain I will never come back, nothing about it was good. Also, I ask for fever tree ginger ale and was bought a brand of ginger ale I never heard of. Disappointment all around

Ok this spot was good as far as pho goes. I got the wings off the happy hour menu they were ok. Also got some pork spring rolls forgot the name of the dish I really enjoyed those. Girlfriend got the chicken pho she said it was nothing worth mentioning. I got the rib eye pho I enjoyed it aside from the text of the beef, it was pretty chewy and bland. The green Thai iced tea was awesome. Would come back again, but nothing to write home about.

Trendy little fusion restaurant. We came to try the Le Pho rolls but out of pork. Did not try pho, but tried spicy duck with noodle and bok choy, too salty and nooodles over cooked but still edible and with added fresh habanero (no chilis) tasty. Ginger chicken was sweet and tasty but not  remarkable. The vegetable fresh rolls were excellent, and would bet Le Pho rolls were better if they had them.....New England Patriots did beat Pittsburg Steelers in AFC championship game and 3 big TVs over bar made it fun to watch. Service here is excellent, I'll come back when they have full menu.

Best broth I've tasted! Been to many Pho restaurants, and this place is by far has the best tasting broth. DO ORDER the Oxtail Pho, the amount of meat they serve is a lot, definitely worth the $. Came here on a late Sunday afternoon and luckily it was also happy hour! $1 oysters baby! The chicken wings is also sooo sooo garlicky good. We also ordered the fresh spring roll, something about it is different than I tasted from other places and it's a good thing. The servers are super pleasant, the ambiance, and decor is on point. The food was so good I failed to take pics of all the yummy goodness. But trust me, everything we ordered was delish! The portions are huge, so the price (for some it may be pricey) is worth it.

Went the other day with my co-workers as we like to try all the new places downtown. I ended up getting the House Banh Mih which was very tasty. It was my second choice as I really wanted the duck bowl but was told they were out when I tried to order. 

I will definitely come back again to try the duck bowl as it really did sound delicious. 

Overall service was good as my water was constantly filled and the chef? Came over to check on us. 

Hopefully all menu items are available next time.
This place is delicious! Would recommend to anyone looking for a great Pho restaurant. Will definitely come back!

Friday afternoon, I came home feeling lousy.  I've been fighting with allergies/a summer cold for a while now, and I was craving pho. 

My incredible husband said that he wanted to take me to dinner and a movie, so I pulled up my trusty Yelp app and looked for Pho spots near us.  

Le Pho was the closest with more than a 3 star rating, so we hopped in the car and drove down.

We're not really frequent visitors to the downtown area, but Le Pho was easy to find, and parking was also easy to find.  Not a huge fan of the "pay to park" meters, but at least we were able to park close by!

The spot is clean and open, and we were invited to sit anywhere we wanted.  Our server stopped over and gave us menus, and brought over water. She was super polite for the entire visit.  I wish I got her name.  

When you check in on the Yelp app, there is a check in offer for a buy one get one free Iced green Thai tea.  I'd never had green Thai tea before, but this was delicious.  It had a very subtle sweet taste.  I'll definitely be having another one next time!

Happy hour is from 3-6, and we arrived at 4, so we were able to take advantage of one of the happy hour specials:  the Le Pho Roll for $4.  

This is absolutely delicious.  grilled 5 spice pork, basil, and other amazingness wrapped up in a rice noodle textured wrapper...we had to let it sit and cool for a moment, but oh man was this delicious!!!

We also ordered the traditional spring roll, which had shrimp, pork, veggies, and noodles.  Perfection.  The peanut sauce was on point as well.

As for the entrees:
Morgan had the oxtail pho.  The broth was a little salty due to the meat, but some herbs and sriracha fixed that right up. The oxtail was tender, and practically falling off the bone.  It was really good.

I had opted for the rib-eye pho, as it was the closes to the Pho Tai that i normally get.  This was exactly what I'd been craving.  The broth was so delicious, there was a TON of rib-eye meat in it, the noodles were cooked perfectly, and the addition of herbs and sriracha helped me to spice some of the sickness out. I actually have left overs for lunch today.

All in all, I was very pleased with our visit.   Service was great, and the food was phenomenal.  We both had 2 huge bowls of pho, 2 drinks, and 2 appetizers for under $50.  Not too shabby!!!

We will definitely be coming back!

Le Pho Rolls!!! The most god tier appetizer i've ever had. i can't get enough of them. and only $4 during happy hour. there's no need to get into details about their pho because its hard to specialize in something and not be decent at it. That being said, it's pretty damn good, and has vegan friendly options. Prices are decent and the the decor is welcoming. i hate parking downtown but dont mind so much for this place. now if only it could be open 24 hours like Pho Kim Long

Everytime I go here, it never disappoints. Beautiful decor (downtown hip, trendy with a south east flair). Service is always impeccable (sat at the bar and bartender was great  and servers at the tables are super helpful and chose out great recommendations from the menu). Food took some time to come out (not too long), but when it did, it was devoured in seconds. 

My favorites have to be:
-nem nuong rolls
-le pho rolls
-pho (personally, I think Le Pho and District One make the best pho broth in town)
-pho dipped sandwich
-banh mi (again, I think their banh mi is the best in Vegas--and that's coming from a Vietnamese-American person)
-lotus root salad
-oysters

They also have daily specials on the board that are pretty spectacular as well. I missed out when had the banh beo, but I'm hoping on my baby prayers they'll do them again.
I had the best sandwich of my life here. This place really is amazing! I ordered the vegan sandwich and I was so impressed and surprised! I will definitely be coming back!!

I'm so glad we found this spot close to our room at the 4 Queens! It was a 10 minute walk and the pho was on point. The egg rolls were a good different, but a tad on the pricey side. Service was wonderful and we never had an empty glass.

After loading down with pho it was well worth the $3 fare for an uber back to Fremont street!

This Vietnamese restaurant is on the bottom floor of The Juhl in Downtown Las Vegas. It is nicely decorated. Big flat screen TV's with games (sports) on. Their bar is pretty impressive.

However, I came here for the food. Their menu has your basic Vietnamese grub.

Vermicelli Bowl:
This is one of my go-to dishes. Grilled pork, vermicelli, peanuts, and fine strips of carrots. Instead of getting the sauce on the side, it was already poured on the vermicelli so, it settled at the bottom of the bowl. 3/5

Pho Dipped:
Banh mi with a side of pho broth to dip your sandwich in. It comes with a side of potato chips. 3/5

These are dishes I've seen at other Vietnamese restaurants and Buddha Belly for half the price. You're paying for the location. The food was just ok.

Asian Fusion Pho who would have thought. My 1st Pho dining out after just relocating from LA a few days ago.  Okay, I knew it wasn't your $8.95 pho like in Rowland Heights but then again that's if you can find parking after going through all the damn traffic.  No parking problem here and not in Spring Mtn Rd but hey, It's Asian Fusion Pho so we go with the flow.
I had the Rib Eye Pho yes, I'm a Rib-Eye Steak person and never saw this ever.  It was the bomb!!!! The soup itself is fusion for sure but it was hella excellent.  The Rib eye cut I would believe in was prime and not choice cut.  Don't know if I'll ever have beef pho again unless it was rib-eye steak.
Also it was served on metal soup bowls and that's an excellent concept as pho needs to stay on the warm to hot side to really enjoy the meal.  The metal soup bowl is one way.  This tells me they understand the whole pho experience.  Many pho places just slammed it in and whatever.  
Yes, there's a whole technical approach to preparing, cooking and eating pho.  Le Pho has the formula for sure.
As Arnold would say, "I'll be back".
You venture out and you will find.

i'm going to give le pho four stars simply because the food is amazing. Unfortunately the service, as what happens to a lot of new restaurants in downtown Las Vegas, was very lacking. Very subpar. On my first visit I had the vegan spring rolls and what seems to be their signature dish: the bahn mi dipped in pho broth with taro chips. it was like a Vietnamese French dip and was a great value... one of the best things i've ever eaten!
on both visits my friend got the vegan pho which is not listed on the menu and neither is the vegetarian option. 
I can easily say that this is the best pho for spa I've ever had in my life and this is definitely the best pho in Vegas. 

BUT we need to discuss the service. First time around she did not know what vegetables were  in the pho. this happened also on the second time around in addition during my second visit our waitress, who is a different waitress then my first visit, did not know the types of sake they had or types of beer they had, or the differences between beer. Both times it took a very long time to get water, attention, menus for the check. from my point of view, it seems like these are all the servers' first serving jobs. very unfamiliar with the menu.

Had lunch here Tuesday July 25th around 1pm. We sat at the bar. Although the rest of the (female) staff were nice, the (male) bartender was not nice or friendly. I always sit at the bar at restos and have eaten all over the country and world. He was by far the least friendly bartender I have ever had the displeasure of experiencing. He was short with a hefty dose of attitude. I hope the other bartenders are not like that bc we enjoyed the food immensely...
Sweetie had oxtail pho, I had duck noodles. Both were excellent. Tons of flavor. My only complaint on the duck noodles is the noodles were stuck together, making it more difficult to eat. Other than that I look forward to trying this spot again. Everything on the menu sounded delicious.

I had a nice experience here. Our server was named Jasmine and she was great! We had 2 house pho bowls and an order of traditional spring rolls. The house pho came with meatball, tendon, ribeye, and tripe. I LOVED IT. Then again, pho is one of my favorite dishes. The broth was delicious and the peanut sauce they served with the spring rolls was yummy too. I think I tasted a bit of coconut in the sauce, which I enjoyed. Service was prompt too, which was a plus for me since I went during my lunch break.

Khai Vu and team does it again by bringing another authentic with a modern twist to Vietnamese cuisine! This place is in downtown LV in the commercial space of the high rise Juhl building. Super cool vibe & feel. Nice bar selection & the food was amazing! Will be returning to bring more friends and try more dishes!
This place is Le Bomb!  Oxtail pho and the traditional spring rolls are Le Delicious!  If I work or live downtown, this would definitely be my Le Place to go!  ;-)

The staff is wonderful, only 4 stars bc of the parking situation..food is good!!! And I am Vietnamese and I am picky ... it's a good fusion of old school meets modern and fresh... wish they had more dessert

Tried this place since I heard it's owned by the same people who owns le Thai (don't quote me on this). The place is located at downtown as well, so parking can be a hassle.  The restaurant looks nice and clean, which is not something you always get at other Vietnamese restaurants... the menu is pretty simple, and of course I had to order the house special pho to see if it's any good.   The food portion is generous and overall taste good, nothing too special tho. So, I have to say for a bowl of pho, $12 is a little overpriced since I can get the same thing (or better tasting ones) at many other places.  Good to try.

I absolutely love pho and have given this place many tries, but Le Pho is always such a disappointment. Overall, the menu and prices are pretentious, the broth flavor is lacking and the banh mi has been sold out on a couple of occasions, regardless if it's lunch or dinner. The saving grace was the unique item of the oxtail pho, but lately the preparation has been less than desirable. On the most recent occasion, a live rolly polly was crawling around the mint leaves for the fried egg roll appetizer, solidifying a one-star rating and ensuring I'll never be back.

This is a great place for pho. The broth is amazing. Had the Ox tail pho which was amazing. The place is clean and very modern style with nice vibe. The staff was efficient and friendly. The price  reasonable.

If you want to get treated like trash by "management/owner". Maybe she had a bad day.... Jasmine, who claims is a server/manager/owner of the business is just plain awful. Her customer service is the worst. She belittled me and did not want to honor my yelp offer (which is not a why I was upset. If there are rules to the offers in which these are clearly stated on the offer, I am more than happy to comply). Jasmine  said it was a dine in only offer (no where on the yelp check-in does it state this), I told her that it was for a previous dine-in that was 2 weeks ago (she asked me for my done in receipt from weeks ago. Who holds on to two week old lunch receipts - she claimed she did and that she wrote every meal off and that she's entitled to at least that). Omg, I honestly cannot believe what I experienced. Broke my heart because their green tea Thai is really good - except today, she added too much ice, too much half & half... just awful. Hope this helps anyone. If you are served by an entitled, condescending server named Jasmine S., run.....

So terrific! Great atmosphere out of the craziness of the Vegas crowd. Great service too. We had a lemon mule specialty drink. So good. Chicken and veggie pho was the best I'd ever had. We will be back.

I came here for lunch a couple months ago and had Pho, which was not impressive.

I came here again today for lunch with my coworker. He and I both got the lotus salads which we both liked. The amount of food was expensive for its price, it was more like an appetizer instead. Anyhow, we also enjoyed the egg rolls.

The service was slow, but the atmosphere was pleasant and wasn't as crowded like when I was there a couple months ago. I will come back and try another dish.

Food is tasty, although more expensive than most Vietnamese restaurants. Maybe we're paying for the atmosphere. Service is slow and pretty terrible for a place that's only 1/3 full at 9:30 on a Thursday night.
Wish I had a good review to write about this restaurant.. Other than the fact that the server assistant was attentive and nice, our visit was subpar in regards to food and service.

Came here from East coast on a lazy Sunday at 1pm for brunch.  We had the hangover pho and philly cheesesteak sandwich.  

Both were great, though the pho was absolutely divine.   Great flavorful rich broth and good cut of beef.  Loved every drop of it.  Cheesesteak was very nice fusion blend of cheesesteak beef with the asian flavors. 

Great service, good food, and walking distance to fremont.  Nice to get away fron touristy things for a moment.

Oh, and they had a live band performing, a pair of asian guys with a lot of very soulful renditions of classic songs.  

A great meal with great ambience.  Will come back next time i'm in vegas.

When my husband and I walked through the door, I fell in love right away. I love how open the place looked it was a total surprise because I didn't expect it took look like that. We were initially sit at the bar but it seemed a bit crowded to us. But I was looking at their bar and they have a very nice selection of liquor.

When we got sat at our table I was a little disappointed the the tables were wobbly... That is one of my pet peeves when I go out to eat. Nothing is more annoying than trying to eat your meal on a wobbly table. (But I guess its just me being in the industry as well... )

Kelvin was our server and he was so sweet. We started of with the Nem Nuong Rolls which were DELICIOUS. I've had it at other places before but I liked the ones here A LOT. The Nem Noung meat was warm where most places don't really serve it that way. And the herbs and veggies that they put into the roll just complement everything so well. I love the red shiso leaf in there- it just adds a brightness to the roll. But make sure you order these, because the table behind us had ordered some and we ordered the last order... SOOOO they sell QUICK! I had also ordered the fish cake with were delicious as well.The texture was nice and the flavors weren't to over powering. And I also liked the fact that they served it with a side of lettuce and pickled veggies to eat it as a wrap.

The chef had also sent out some Eggrolls as well some specialty dish. I really wish I had asked what it was because they were both awesome. The specialty dish had some shrimp, pork and pickled veggies all served on a shrimp chip. Very nice and scrumptious. The eggrolls came out super hot, (Just like I like them) and they were served with a side of veggies as well. (I Love when they do that) And their dipping sauce was on point. Not too garlicky, not too salty, with right amount of sweetness as well. Yum!

We both Ordered the house special, and I had ordered mine with the Additional Bone Marrow and Scallion Oil because it intrigued me. When it came out, it was nice and hot. (You'll be surprised how many times we've had pho that just came out warm.) So that was super awesome. And they had put the Bone Marrow and Scallion Oil on the side. I like to taste my pho first before i add any additional seasoning and it was PERFECT. Nice balance of flavor, not too salty, not too sweet. The cuts of meat that they used in there were super delicious as well. And their CILANTRO... My husband thought I was a little crazy, But the Cilantro that they used was sooooooooooooooooooooooo good, I've never had cilantro that tasted like that before, it was so good. (I wonder where they get their cilantro from.)

All in all, I would most definitely be back, It may be a little bit pricier than your average bowl of Pho, BUT you can tell that they use the best quality ingredients and that there is love in the food Something a lot of places lack now a days. And service was great as well so that made our meal even better.

Definitely next time I'm in Vegas this place is a most stop! The Pho is amazing and the tea was Super good!

Ribeye Pho

We came here on a date night before a show at the smith's center. I have the beef Phó. My wife had one of the French dip sandwiches.  Both were amazing. We are back tonight for round #2. This time with another couple. I'll have something different. I'm excited to see how the Absinthe turns how. They have a chilled water drip to make the drink. This place has been added to our list of downtown date night spots.
Was very happy with this place, the service was excellent, and the food was awesome. Also, the cocktails were on spot!
Yay! Service has improved a lot as well as cleanliness. The pho soup was excellent; not too salty and not cloudy... really liked it.
This restaurant is great, customer service is excellent and it's always easy to eat here on my lunch break and be back to work on time!

Pho is my "go to" when I'm hungover, and let me tell you, THIS IS THE BEST PHO I'VE EVER HAD. I had the ribeye and flank pho. The meat was very tender; it completely melts in your mouth! The broth is so flavorful and just delicious. Diamond our waitress was so sweet and very helpful. I will definitely be back every time I come to Vegas!

Great place for lunch if you're in the downtown area.

I don't go to DTLV... but if you're in the area I highly recommend coming here.

Everything I had here was delicious and if you're looking for a drink... order the green thai ice tea! 

Tons of different seating options and great for groups. Love the ambiance and vibe that it brings to DTLV.

Street parking right outside.

Thanks Chef Khai!

I'm a fan.

- Miss Yelp 2017

We ordered: the Le Pho roll, the Banh Mi dip, the flat noodles, and the egg rolls. Wow. The pho broth is the best I have had in memory. The Banh Mi was very simply one of the best sandwiches in Vegas. Between eating here and the Goodwich  (via Postmates this week) DTLV has stepped up its food game again. Bravo!! And Veronica, our server, was terrific.
By far Best Pho in Vegas! True Hanoi style........ reminded me of my days in NYC, where I ate Pho every week.  Truly the best in Las Vegas.try it  and youll be happy you did !

They have a whole line of vegan / vegetarian food that isn't on the menu (just ask!). The vegan pho is very good. They'll even our tofu in it if you ask. But, hands down, the vegan vermicelli bowl is the best. It is cool and refreshing! For my non-vegan friends, everyone raves about the egg rolls.
This place is pretty good! Smells awesome when you walk in and super clean and spacious. Coming back next time I'm in Vegas !

Love this place!  So glad we tried it!  We will definitely come back! Foods were delicious & flavorful, excellent customer service, reasonable prices, & restaurant has a relaxed ambiance!  Even though we had to pay to park on the street, it was worth it! Definitely recommend Le Pho to my family & friends!

Been here a bunch of times.  If you haven't met chef Khai, he's a great guy and passionate chef.  I have noticed a little inconsistency which is typical of chefs that run numerous restaurants, but when Le Pho nails it it's the best pho I've ever had in my life.  The grilled pork spring rolls and sandwiches are damn good as well.
I had the house special pho which was very good; generous portion and tasty broth. The room was nicely decorated and the service attentive. This restaurant is a great addition to the downtown area.
The pho was insanely amazing! Too good! The broth is yummy! The service was great and the ambiance very nice. The only thing I would suggest is maybe a couple more waitresses.

We ordered 2 shrimp pho and an order of spring rolls Togo. The way they packed everything was nice but both of the pho were super salty. The actual springs rolls were good, unfortunately the peanut butter dip for the spring rolls was not the best it had a funny taste. We will not be going back. Sorry!

I would love to say this is 3.5 stars.

The trendy atmosphere and downtown locale will make a great spot for a business lunch or dinner. It is relatively easy to find and get to, but you will likely pay for parking (think about $1 per hour). The tables were clean and tidy, along with the rest of the dining area. 

The prices are more than fair and you can see the effort in their presentation of the meals. We ordered the crispy wings, not necessarily traditional, but they were crispy, flavorful, and tender inside. The traditional spring rolls were fresh but bland. The peanut sauce served along side it was slightly too sweet, but others loved it.

Now... for the pho! The soup came in a clay pot with the usual fresh basil, mung beans, jalapeño, and limes. This plate was freshly cut and chilled for a zesty compliment to the broth. The noodles were perfectly cooked and the broth was not overly salted. They only have siracha as a chili sauce - but order a side of it if you like your pho a little spicy - as theirs can seem pale compared to more traditional resturants. I'm sure pickier eaters will do well with this version of pho of they have not liked it in the past.

Service was great even with this being a 'soft' opening. Our server was accomodating, friendly, and let us be during most of our meal.
This place is so GOOD. I got the Ox tail pho w fried tofu pieces. SO much flavor. I literally can't eat any other pho after eating here. Definitely go here!!!

We went there for a quick dinner because this restaurant is in our apartment building. It was the very first time I tried Vietnamese cuisine! I tried ginger chicken with rice and House Pho. Both dishes were absolutely delicious and were so unusual to my taste buds. A sort of combination of sweet and salty. The portions are huge too. Drinks are a little bit expensive.
This place is awesome! It's the best pho I've ever had! The broth is spicy and absolutely delicious, and the veggies are fresh. It has a cool bar, and music playing. I love it!
